title: Intern, Product Management
requirements:
Description

Location: San Jose, CA, United States
Type of Employee: Intern

Vocera delivers the leading platform for clinical communication and workflow. Our mission is to simplify and improve the lives of healthcare professionals, patients, and families while enabling hospitals to enhance quality of care and operational efficiency and humanize the healthcare experience. Hospitals and health systems around the world have selected our solutions to enable care teams to communicate and collaborate using smartphones or our hands-free, wearable Vocera Smartbadge and Vocera Badge. They can create a richer, more human connection for patients and their loved ones before, during, and after care using Vocera Ease applications. Our platform is interoperable with most clinical and operational systems used in hospitals. In addition to healthcare, Vocera solutions are found in aged care facilities, veterinary hospitals, luxury hotels, retail stores, schools, power facilities, libraries, and more. Vocera is headquartered in San Jose, California, with offices in Indiana, Orlando, Canada, India, United Arab Emirates, Australia, and the United Kingdom. Learn more at www.vocera.com and follow @VoceraComm and @VoceraEase on Twitter.

Position Description: Vocera is looking for an Intern to join our Product Management team. This internship is an opportunity to learn and develop your professional product management skills. You will have hands on experience assisting with customer beta testing, owning real time project deliverables, and will gain industry knowledge. Our internship is designed for individuals who are currently enrolled at an accredited college/university and who will be continuing their studies in the fall.

Responsibilities
Assist with deliverables that support Vocera’s Beta testing program, such as: writing, delivering and summarizing customer surveys, creating and managing a beta program enhancement submission process, Gathering data related to effort required to deploy beta products, participating in beta product testing
Assist with deliverables that support Vocera’s inclusion in a healthcare or API marketplace, including: Collaborating with Marketing departments from both vendors to submit online descriptions of Vocera products while ensuring compliance with brand guidelines, and, conducting research on healthcare/API marketplaces to create a summary of available features
Learn from the team to think strategically and creatively to gather product and customer insights and distill those into actionable knowledge
Build trust and effective relationships with cross-functional teams
Participate in product management and customer meetings and observe how product managers are key to achieving an exemplary customer experience
Competencies
Knowledge of product management, marketing or engineering concepts
Enjoys working with others and have an enthusiasm for problem solving
Well organized with strong attention to detail; proactively ensures work is accurate and error-free
Self-motivated and aptitude to learn quickly
Positive attitude and work ethic, with the ability to work 100% remotely and collaborate with global team members
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong sense of professionalism

Requirements
Candidates should be seeking a Bachelor’s or Advanced degree in Marketing, Product Management, Engineering or related field
Proficiency with Microsoft Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint )
Able to work independently at times and dedicate a minimum of 20 hours/week
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction
Must be willing to submit to a background investigation, including verification of your employment and criminal history
Must be 18 years of age or older
Belief in Diversity

Vocera Communications is an Affirmative Action Employer committed to workforce diversity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, or genetic information.

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions for the advertising industry and we’re looking for a Product Management Intern to join our Product team. If you are excited by technology that has the power to handle hundreds of thousands of transactions per second; collect tens of billions of events each day; and evaluate thousands of data-points in real-time all while responding in just a few milliseconds, then IAS is the place for you!

As a Product Intern you will have a great opportunity to work closely with Senior Product Managers to gain a holistic understanding of the product management process in a scaled, fast-growing tech company. You will have valuable exposure to many different departments (Sales, Marketing, Data Science, R&D, Client Services) to improve IAS solutions - impacting both the software development itself and how we bring it to market.

What You’ll Get To Do
Identify features or workflows that would increase customer satisfaction in our UI platform, core capabilities, and/or reporting
Establish persona-tailored best practices to ensure we are delivering value for our clients.
Examine customer usage metrics of our platform and product to identify useful insights
Collaborate with other internal teams (UI/UX, Data Science, R&D, etc) to identify and discuss future enhancements to our platforms
Research new technologies and capabilities

title: 2021 Platform Product Manager Intern
requirements:
2021 Platform Product Manager Intern

About Five9

Five9 provides businesses reliable, scalable, and secure cloud contact center software designed to create exceptional customer experiences, increase agent productivity, and deliver tangible business results.

We are driven by a passion to transform contact centers into customer engagement centers of excellence. Since 2001, Five9 has led the cloud revolution in contact centers, helping organizations transition from legacy premise-based solutions to the cloud.

Internship Program

At Five9 we are committed to providing an exceptional experience for our interns. We tailor our program to provide participants with real, impactful work, contributing directly to the continued success of Five9. Through our Speaker Series and Events, you’ll have the opportunity to meet and learn from some of the best in the business.

As An Intern At Five9, You Can Expect To

Learn. Learn about yourself, your field and what makes Five9 special.

“I am proud that I was able to learn so many new concepts and systems in such a short amount of time and was able to contribute on a team to actual software development projects.” – 2020 VoIP Software Engineering Intern

Ability to deal with ambiguity and distill product requirements that are engineering ready

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
BARKSDALE, INC.
JOB DESCRIPTION


Job Title: Product Management Intern                                           
FLSA: Non-exempt          
Location: Los Angeles                                                                             
Reports To: Product Manager

ABOUT US

Barksdale, founded in 1949, is a leading manufacturer of highly engineered control products. As a subsidiary of Crane Co. a $3B industrial conglomerate, Barksdale has a leading brand position in instrumentation, with focus on General Industrial, Oil & Gas and Transportation end markets. With proprietary technologies, Barksdale’s valves, regulators, pressure switches electronic and speed instrumentation products have carved a niche for themselves in demanding applications. Supported by strong financial standing, the business is positioned to continue double-digit annual growth over the next 5 – 10 years.

JOB SUMMARY

The Product Management Intern will be a key contributor with the primarily responsibility of supporting the Transportation vertical market to build marketing analysis tools to drive process improvement of new product release. This intern will have the opportunity to learn Barksdale’s control product lines and work closely with our engineers and cross functional teams to enable growth and improve business performance (streamline processes and reduce waste). 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

These responsibilities including projects and other tasks assigned are subject for modifications: 

Product Management Tool- Develop tools to enable revenue growth and improve quality for the Transportation vertical; Create valve kit packages/cross reference table to gain Aftermarket share; Create/update “handle directory” to consolidate all information on existing handles to facilitate customization of new products, avoid duplication and to minimize cost; Build a configuration spreadsheet for a specific product that will enable our applications team to easily put together a preliminary bill of material based product feature and available components; Convert old/create assembly prints to current standard to minimize production build errors and improve our overall quality

Process Improvement Tool: Build analysis tools to drive process improvement that will grow profitability through pricing actions and inventory control; Build a forecast model based on customer forecast and historic trend analysis; Develop a pricing analysis model/template based on historic cost, sales price and volume – to output recommendations based on select input by specific customer; Create/update the current “costed bill of material” template using macros to interface with our ERP system to reduce time and improve costing/pricing accuracy for new part numbers for new business opportunities/projects
 PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE/ QUALIFICATIONS

Must be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program, preferably in Engineering, Business, Computer Science or related technical degree
Must possess a GPA of 3.5 or higher
Proficient in Excel
High attention to detail
SolidWorks experience preferred
Ability to read and understand 2D engineering/technical drawings

title: Product Management Intern, Monitoring Platform
requirements:
Do you want to change the world? We do, too.

The energy market is roughly $4 trillion globally, and solar penetration is less than 1%. But just one hour of sunlight, if harnessed, could power the entire world for a year. We have the opportunity to completely change the way energy is produced, distributed and consumed on a global scale, and we’re looking for talented, committed people to help us drive our growth and achieve our goals.

SunPower is a global solar energy solutions company with a rich heritage of pioneering the best energy technologies in the world. Our solutions are unrivaled in terms of long-term reliability, efficiency and guaranteed performance, and our company is unmatched in terms of global reach and scale. Through design, manufacturing, installation and ongoing maintenance and monitoring, SunPower provides its proprietary, world-record efficient solar technology to residential, commercial and utility customers worldwide.

SunPower is changing the way our world is powered every day with a brilliant, passionate and driven team of more than 2,000 in North America and the Phillipines. In an industry that is reshaping the world’s energy future, there’s no better place to be than SunPower.

The Experience We Would Expect The Ideal Person To Deliver Is

We believe that our employees create our brand – with each project, each communication, each task completed and each interaction. Experience is critical to SunPower in regards to not only our customers but also our employees and dealer partners. As such, we strive to hire candidates that are service focused.

SunPower is seeking a high-energy Software Product Manager for our next-generation monitoring platform, as part of our internship program

This role will be responsible for building upon SunPower’s monitoring software. Core responsibilities include participation in the creation, validation, and on-going refinement of the overall software strategy, and leading the development of the monitoring platform – both as part of SunPower’s comprehensive digital strategy. The ideal candidate will be strong both commercially and technically, and comfortable engaging with a variety of stakeholders across our customers, partners, suppliers, and internal organization. This person must have experience managing a consumer-oriented web and mobile product, and be capable of driving business-level decisions at all levels of the organization.

The product manager must be comfortable working with users to identify pain points, designers to visualize new features, and engineers to transform stories into the software. Must be adept at writing user stories, executing with engineers, and managing an agile backlog.

The position will touch all aspects of SunPower’s monitoring platform – from the IoT platform to B2B and B2C applications to Analytics

ESSENTIAL DUTIES Include The Following
Manage the development of the next generation of SunPower’s monitoring software, through which SunPower’s systems are monitored and managed
Work with the design team to develop user personas based on qualitative and quantitative data, user interviews, and user workshops
Work with SunPower dealers and homeowners to identify software pain points
Generate product insights based on identified feature requests, pain points, and overall software strategy
Clearly articulate product decisions to users, the product team, internal stakeholders, and engineers
Manage project planning, sprint and release planning, demos, and other Scrum-related meetings
Create, maintain, prioritize, and sequence the product backlog based on business value or ROI
Conduct post-launch user feedback sessions to support continuous software improvement
Provide ongoing tracking and analysis of key product competitors
Collaborate with marketing, brand, customer experience, and other software stakeholders to create a uniform software experience across SunPower software systems
Work alongside other product managers to deliver interdependent feature sets

Experience

Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree

Minimum Requirements
Student must be one semester or one year out from graduation
Demonstrated ability to work with, and coordinate, cross-functional teams
A proven ability to communicate effectively to a wide variety of clients and partners

Preferred Requirements
Passon for the solar industry and product management

Characteristics
Strong communications skills – both verbal and written
Ability to absorb complex subjects and distill them into an easily digestible form for other team members
Self-starter, able to thrive in a fast-paced and continually changing environment
Leadership skills and strong analytical skills

Other Pertinent Information
The candidate must be legally entitled to work and reside in the United States

Summer Intern Program Overview
10-12 week summer program
Interns will individually work under the direction of their managers and will participate in a series of preplanned events throughout the summer, including executive presentations, a team-building day, and an end-of-program intern presentation to his/her manager and eStaff member about the project they delivered during their internship.
All interns will complete the program by the last day of August 2021. At the completion of the program, the intern will be evaluated and considered for possible future full-time employment upon graduation.
Hourly-based, paid internship, approximately 40 hours per week.
Intern responsible for acquiring housing accommodations if they are not local to the office

title: Product Intern - Loyalty and Extension
requirements:
The Purpose

As a Product Management Intern, you will be responsible for the largest social network dedicated to helping shoppers save. You help develop the vision, user experience, engineering execution, and delivery of features that help shoppers score savings. You will determine what features we launch next and why. You will use your analytical skills to sift through new feature test results and seek opportunities for new tests. If you are a creative thinker who is obsessed with intuitive experiences that benefit humanity you will thrive here. As an intern, you will work alongside multiple seasoned product managers and get exposure to emerging products at Slickdeals with a focus on growth.

The Role
Care passionately about every step of each shopper’s journey.
Pursue opportunities to personalize services for members.
Exude strong product sense, execution, and leadership skills.
Constantly evaluate how well products serve goals. Identify elements that contribute or detract. Find opportunities to better serve the goals.
Use data to help make clear decisions about products and customers
Communicate and get buy-off on those decisions with Product Managers, engineering teams, and other business stakeholders to ensure coordination and completion of responsible products.
Understand consumer behaviors and needs through research, internal and third-party analytics, and direct interactions with shoppers.
Develop new features and deliver enhancements to existing products that differentiate Slickdeals from the competition.
Work closely with Design, Engineering, Content, Marketing, and Business Development teams to manage and ultimately release new or updated product features.
Ensure timely delivery of projects through proper planning, scheduling, and execution.
Analyze and act on business metrics and data to grow the business.
Perform other duties as assigned.


The Candidate
Ability to see signals in the noise of your quantitative and qualitative research.
Interest in creating products and features from scratch following a path of research, ideation, building, measuring, learning, and iterating.

title: Product Manager Intern - Summer 2021
requirements:
At Nuna, our mission is to make high-quality healthcare affordable and accessible for everyone. We are dedicated to tackling one of our nation’s biggest problems with ingenuity, creativity, and a keen moral compass.

Nuna is committed to simple principles: a rigorous understanding of data, modern technology, and most importantly, compassion and care for our fellow human. We want to know what really works, what doesn't—and why.

Nuna partners with healthcare payers, including government agencies, health plans, and employers, to turn data into learnings and information into meaning.

YOUR TEAM
Product Managers at Nuna guide our products from concept to launch and beyond! We’re the voice of our customers within Nuna and love learning about their needs and challenges in order to craft better solutions. We thrive in ambiguous situations, manage chaos with a sense of humor, and have a bias towards action that is data‐driven and purposeful.

The Product Management Intern will report to a Senior Product Manager and work closely with User Experience, Engineering, and Data Science to improve existing products and develop new features and capabilities.

This is a high-impact, remote, 12-week paid internship starting in June for students graduating by 2022.
YOUR IMPACT
Nuna was founded to bring accountability to a healthcare system that is currently broken and consistently fails patients across the U.S. When there’s more accountability for the cost and quality of care—when the value of care matters more than the volume of care—patients, payers, and providers stand to benefit.

Our Meaningful Matches product helps health plans connect their members with primary care providers (PCPs) who are available, accessible, and high quality. We do this by deploying our proprietary matching algorithm in a health plan’s existing PCP selection and assignment processes in order to drive better member satisfaction and engagement, and healthcare quality and cost.
YOUR OPPORTUNITIES
You’ll learn from more senior product managers, because we are learners, not knowers, and you’ll have the opportunity to influence them, because growing Nuna’s people is the most reliable way to scale our impact.
You’ll explore and develop novel product solutions as catalysts for healthcare-wide transition to value-based care. We ground decisions in user feedback and rapidly iterate to ensure that we’re addressing the problems we aim to solve.
You’ll work as part of a team, not in a silo. At Nuna we rise by lifting up others.
You’ll work cross functionally with design, data science, engineering and customer implementation to deliver a data-driven and user-first experience.
You’ll work closely with other interns and participate in resume and career planning workshops throughout the duration of your internship.
YOU BRING
Exceptional communication and listening skills - you break down problems and generate shared understanding across technical and non-technical audiences.
Attention to detail and ability to document product and business needs across multiple stakeholders. You are user-obsessed and can translate their needs into product requirements
Desire to learn the ins and outs of a product to measurably improve it.
Get-it-done personality with a bias towards testing and execution.
Prior experience or interest in working on healthcare analytics products and the opportunities and challenges of building them to scale.
Entrepreneurial, leadership, and/or organizational dynamic skills.
Ability to collaborate on a roadmap to prioritize competing demands across multiple stakeholders.
2+ years of relevant professional, volunteer, and/or academic experience.
BONUSES
Prior experience working on healthcare analytics products.
Proven track record of launching enterprise products in the analytics or healthcare space.
Experience working with teams of engineers and data scientists.


Nuna is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics and/or veteran status.

title: Product Management Intern, PointCentral
requirements:
Position Overview

PointCentral (Subsidiary of Alarm.com), a rapidly expanding, entrepreneurial technology company, is seeking an ambitious, hard-working candidate with strong academic qualifications, diverse interests, and proven experiences in a dynamic team environment. This position will allow interns to develop product management skills required to deliver solutions used by our partners and internal teams. The Product Management Intern will work closely with internal product and software development teams. The role requires attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects.

Few companies innovate and develop across as broad of a range of technologies as PointCentral and Alarm.com. This position is ideal for the candidate who seeks a small, friendly company culture where one can work closely with smart and highly productive people across a very interesting spectrum of technologies to develop outstanding consumer products.

Responsibilities

The Product Management Intern will join the team as a contributor and assist with delivery of new features and produce enhancements. This will include many aspects of the product management lifecycle but tasks will depend on the status of projects in progress during the internship period. Job responsibilities may include:
Writing specifications for the engineering team, testing new products and features, developing product marketing materials and technical documentation and supporting existing products
Assisting with go-to market strategy and launches for new products – facilitating product release with engineering, sales, supply chain etc., and developing/delivering product presentations
Conducting market research – gathering feedback from customers and analyzing product landscape
Working with engineering, support, sales and partners to troubleshoot and resolve escalated product issues


Requirements
Currently Pursuing a Bachelors Degree
Highly motivated, resourceful, self-starter with ability to deliver results
Strong quantitative, analytical, and critical thinking skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously in a small, fast-paced environment
Passion for consumer technology and interest in developing a deep technical understanding of Alarm.com and partner products
Willingness to assist in variety of product related tasks (logistical, testing, troubleshooting, planning)
Ability to act as customer advocate in dynamic group environment while considering team's overall priorities and goals
Strong computer skills (e.g. Excel, Word, PowerPoint)


WHY WORK FOR POINTCENTRAL?
Collaborate with outstanding people: We hire only the best. Our standards are high and our employees enjoy working alongside other high achievers.
Make an immediate impact: New employees can expect to be given real responsibility for bringing new technologies to the marketplace. You are empowered to perform as soon as you join the Alarm.com team!
Gain well rounded experience: Alarm.com offers a diverse and dynamic environment where you will get the chance to work directly with executives and develop expertise across multiple areas of the business.
Work with the latest technologies: You'll gain exposure to a broad spectrum of IoT, SaaS and M2M technologies including wireless communication, video monitoring, smart home automation, web development, and backend application development and hosting.
Focus on fun: Alarm.com places high value on our team culture. We even have a committee dedicated to hosting a stand-out holiday party, happy hours, and other fun corporate events.


For more information, please visit PointCentral.com

Alarm.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer

In connection with your application, we collect information that identifies, reasonably relates to or describes you ("Personal Information"). The categories of Personal Information that we may collect include your name, government-issued identification number(s), email address, mailing address, other contact information, emergency contact information, employment history, educational history, criminal record, and demographic information.  We collect and use those categories of Personal Information about you for human resources and other business management purposes, including identifying and evaluating you as a candidate for potential or future employment or future positions, recordkeeping in relation to recruiting and hiring, conducting criminal background checks as permitted by law, conducting analytics, and ensuring compliance with applicable legal requirements and Company policies.

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
Want to change the way work…works? This is your moment.

RingCentral Glip integrates messaging with video to make conversation, collaboration and connection more meaningful than ever, no matter where or how people want to work.

At RingCentral we call our interns RingTerns because, by the end of your 10-week program, you’ll know our culture inside and out. Why is that important? Our culture is what makes RingCentral unique, a place where winning together in a dynamic, highly collaborative environment is what makes us different (and, we like to think, better).

If you are interested in an internship here, chances are you have some relevant skills and are interested in working for a rapidly growing, cloud-based software and communications company. We can teach you the RingCentral-way what we can’t teach, is drive and a passion to succeed.

Here are a few reasons to consider being a RingTern at RingCentral:
You have a competitive edge and like to win . Here, you’ll compete for prizes with individual elevator pitches, team product challenges, off-site excursions, and company events. We call it a collaborative competition and it’s a great way to experience the way we work.
Hyper-growth, for you and your career. RingCentral is growing at an annual rate of 30%. Every year. So now is a great time to join us. It also means there are lots of interesting, real-world challenges to help us solve.
Mentors who are in it for you. Our mentors will work with you to help you grow and achieve your goals. No micro-management and no busy-work. The goal is to help you problem-solve and succeed independently.
So, join RingCentral as an intern this summer and discover what it feels like to win, together.

Final Intern Application Deadline: April 23, 2021

Job Scope
Manage new & existing Integration apps used by our customers.
Plan & prioritize product features to ensure it aligns with customer needs & company goals.
Work with our design & engineering teams to implement simple & intuitive but robust features for our customers.
Work with Product Marketing, Alliances & Sales teams to bring products & features to market.

Qualifications
Pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in computer science, engineering, design, or business.
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to work cross-functionally with remote teams.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently on key projects

Learning Skills/Outcomes
Build your leadership skills by owning popular RingCentral apps and driving projects across multiple teams
Learn real-world skills in project management, design, prioritization, and interviewing customers
Become an SME on communication products for Small Businesses & Enterprises.
Learn about managing customer relationships, sales, marketing, design & engineering practices at a fast-growing Silicon Valley company,

Availability
Full-time [10-week internship]
Must be available to start either June 8th, 2021 or June 15th, 2021
Visit the links below to know more about the company, internships and job openings:

About RingCentral - RingCentral’s Website

Openings - Job & Internship webpage

Say hello to the future of work. And the end of the resume black hole.

We didn’t create Glip specifically for hiring, but we might as well have. No more wondering if your resume was jettisoned into the vast emptiness of space. Sign up for Glip (it’s free, no downloads,) and discover how smooth, informative and great the hiring process can be. So start meeting on www.glip.com — and we look forward to connecting soon.

About RingCentral

RingCentral is the worldwide leader in cloud-based communications. Our software communications platform delivers phone, group chat, mobile communications, video calls, videoconference, contact center and AI-driven digital engagement. It’s a powerful, global presence that allows businesses to communicate anywhere, anytime with anyone.

RingCentral is headquartered in Belmont, California and has offices around the world.

RingCentral is an equal opportunity employer that truly values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: US Internship: Product Management
requirements:
Alation continues to hire for roles at various locations with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19 crisis. Everyone new to the Alation team, along with our current workforce, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices.

Alation pioneered the data catalog market and today is leading its evolution into a platform for a broad range of data intelligence solutions including data search & discovery, data governance, and digital transformation. Nearly 230 enterprises drive data culture, improve decision making, and realize business outcomes with Alation. For more information, visit https://www.alation.com/



Due to Covid-19, this will be a remote role for the 2021 Internship Program



Alation’s Product Management team defines the product strategy by collaborating with our customers and the Design and Engineering teams to identify new products and solutions, driving the implementation, and partnering with the GTM teams to ensure fast adoption. As a PM Intern, you will experience all stages of this process by working on a future product: you will define a solution and validate it with customers. If you are up for the challenge of working on a solution that will shape Alation’s roadmap for the next few years, then this opportunity is for you!

In your internship, you will get exposed to a variety of projects that span…
product & solution definition - take ownership of a real product solution, help develop the strategy and roadmap for the solution and experience the feature development process, from inception to implementation
customer insights - work with customers to gather their feedback and insights to identify product opportunities and potential solutions
product metrics & insights - dig into drivers of product usage and adoption, determine metrics to target and monitor through launch, making recommendations for product direction
scrum team participation - collaborate with the Engineering and Design teams on detailed product requirements and backlog management
go-to-market strategy & execution - partner with GTM teams (Product Marketing, Customer Success) to develop launch plans and enable sellers to drive business success
mentorship - work closely with and be mentored by experienced, full-time product managers

You should...
currently be pursuing a Master's degree in Business Administration or another advanced degree, with 2-4 years work experience
have excellent communication skills: communicate clearly about complex technical solutions and relating them to business results - You can excite others with your ideas
have strong business acumen and a data-driven approach to decision making
excited to work in a fast-paced environment

Please provide your resume and a concise cover letter highlighting your interest in this role and what you would like to gain from this internship.

Our founders have come together from different backgrounds: business, engineering, and design. This unique mix from our founding team is important to the Alation culture story. Today, our team consists of creators and communicators with varied backgrounds - from Stanford, to the Indian Institute of Technology, big companies and one-person startups, the United States, and abroad. We continue to seek ever more diverse perspectives as we grow.

requirements:

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
CBRE is in the process of further developing and globally expanding our core technology products in the Valuations space. title: Product Management Intern -Summer 2021
requirements:
SMS Assist is looking for a Product Manager Intern for our 2021 Summer Internship program!

The SMS Assist Summer Internship program is a full-time, paid opportunity that will run from June 8th –August 14th. An internship at SMS Assist will provide an opportunity to work with a fast-paced, growing company in Chicago’s vibrant technology scene. Each intern in our summer group goes through one week of training together as a cohort and are placed in one of our departments, where they’ll spend around 75% of their time throughout the summer. The other 25% is spent engaging in intern-specific activities and learning opportunities, such as executive lunch & learns, personal development workshops, and access throughout the company for informational interviews. During the internship, the program interns will work together on an SMS Assist business case and they will present their findings and ideas at the conclusion of the internship for SMS Assist leadership and other key team members. Of course, we have some fun social events thrown in there as well!

Job Classification
This is a full time, non-exempt position
The schedule for this position is Monday- Friday 8:00 AM-5:00 PM
The SMS Assist Summer Internship program is a full-time, paid opportunity that will run from June-August. An internship at SMS Assist will provide an opportunity to work with a fast-paced, growing company in Chicago’s vibrant technology scene. At SMS Assist, the internship program is about developing yourself while having a real, memorable, and fun career experience.

Core Responsibilities

The internship role will be in the ProdTech department.
Ability to collaborate with business partners and stakeholders to discover and articulate requirements and user stories, prioritize based on value and development effort, and deliver per customer contracts and/or requests with high quality and predictability
Ability to collaborate with customers, software engineering, operations personnel, sales and other product managers to ensure on-time delivery of product software features that focus on creating data-driven actionable insights that optimize customer facilities maintenance spend and improve operational efficiency
Strong systems-thinking skills for considering holistic implications of decisions, cause-and -effect, effective portfolio prioritization to support top-level business objectives
Translate business requirements into user stories for the development team
Translate technical capabilities, constraints and impediments to business stakeholders in human terms
Effectively collaborate with UI/UX, QA, Product Managers and Developers
Strong communication skills—able to make the complex simple; can describe technology in terms of business implications and translate business needs into technical requirements
Ensure confidentiality of internal and external data
Aid in the modification or enhancement of the internship program
We have two Product Management internship opportunities. You will be assigned to one of these two focus areas.
The Communications Platform product which involves in-portal messaging, texting, emails, IVR, and other communication methods
The New Customer and Integrations team focused on developing new features for Business Units, supporting features for new customer implementations, and developing the API platforms for integrating with external sources
Key Competencies
Strong written and verbal communication skills through telephone and email
Proficient with Microsoft (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Must be pro-active and have the ability to operate effectively both independently and within a team
Flexible and adaptable
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects/assignments simultaneously
Working knowledge of JIRA a plus

Education And Experience
Must be a rising junior or senior enrolled in a full-time Bachelor’s degree program in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related disciplines, or a recent graduate
MBA candidate preferred
Knowledge of Agile Scrum methodologies; Dual track scrum knowledge a plus
Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without sponsorship now or in the future (we are unable to hire on F1 or OPT visas at this time for our summer program)
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
Traits: Attention to detail, critical thinker, team player, self-directed, and motivated

Please note, this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities, and schedule may change at any time with or without notice.

SMS Assist is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) that welcomes and encourages all applicants to apply regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify and/or expression, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital or parental status, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy or other reasons prohibited by law.

title: Category Management Intern (Summer 2021)
requirements:
Company Description

Wish is a mobile e-commerce platform that flips traditional shopping on its head. We connect hundreds of millions of people with the widest selection of delightful, surprising, and—most importantly—affordable products delivered directly to their doors. Each day on Wish, millions of customers in more than 160 countries around the world discover new products. For our over 1 million merchant partners, anyone with a good idea and a mobile phone can instantly tap into a global market.

We're fueled by creating unique products and experiences that give people access to a new type of commerce, where all are welcome. If you’ve been searching for a supportive environment to chase your curiosity and use data to investigate the questions that matter most to you, this is the place.

Job Description

Your goal as CPG Category Management Intern at Wish is to develop our growing 1st and 3rd party business, using data-driven analysis to bring optimal supply that delivers results, through understanding our Wish platform and the needs of our customers. The CPG Category Management Intern will then match this supply to demand through consumer segmentation, in-app and external marketing, and by implementing product features that will enable new ways to sell products (e.g. merchandise bundles, multi-item orders with item/shipping discounts, subscription plans).

A successful CPG Category Management Intern will be able to effectively identify growth opportunities and work with external partners and internal stakeholders to remove barriers and find solutions to grow.

The ideal candidate is passionate about Wish and e-commerce growth at scale, has a strong innate curiosity, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

What You’ll Be Doing
Build & grow key CPG brands, via 1st and 3rd party relationships in U
Evaluate costs/benefits of various CPG supply sources and develop overall P&L model
Process 1st-party purchase orders, catalogue creation & shipping plans, in timely manner
Evaluate supplier quotes and key benchmarks
Proactively manage technical and operational hurdles in new merchant on-boarding
Develop product/feature requirements to grow CPG category (e.g. merchandise bundles, multi-item orders with item/shipping discounts, subscription plans)
Effectively communicate & collaborate with relevant internal stakeholders
Demonstrate analytical thinking and leverage data to drive decision making

Qualifications
Minimum 3 years' job experience (CPG experience essential); exceptional recent college graduates will be considered
Knowledge of the CPG and online shopping industry, particularly with marketplaces & marketplace sellers
Previous experience in a similar role strongly desired (Category Management, Strategy Analysis, Product Management, Business Development, Marketing)
Highly competitive, smart, detail-oriented, relentlessly resourceful
Strong personal presence with excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, & proficiency in CRM systems
Familiarity with Tableau, SQL, Jira desired
Team-oriented but has the ability to work independently
Agile individual with the ability to work autonomously in a demanding and ambiguous environment

Additional Information

Wish values diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate based on any legally-protected class or characteristic. Employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Individuals applying for positions at Wish, including California residents, can see our privacy policy here.

title: Launchpad Internship Program - Summer 2021
requirements:
Description

The Silicon Labs Launchpad Program is a summer internship with a focus on providing technical experience and professional mentorship for freshman and sophomore students from groups that have been historically underrepresented in the tech industry.

About Silicon Labs

We are Silicon Labs – the leading provider of silicon, software and solutions for a smarter, more connected world.

Our interns solve real-world problems within a small, collaborative group of world-class engineers. As a Silicon Labs Intern, you will help develop industry-leading Internet of Things (IoT), infrastructure and automotive solutions, while being mentored and closely guided by teams who have a vested interest in your success. You’ll also have many opportunities to learn, network, and develop new skills through our social events, professional development trainings, and volunteer opportunities.

Excited to learn more? Check out what it’s like to be a part of the Silicon Labs Team:
http://bit.ly/JoinSilabs2
bit.ly/WhySilabsInternship
bit.ly/WomenatSilabs2


What You’ll Do

Our intern projects are designed to help you to grow your skillset while making meaningful contributions to our business and the world.

Here are just a few of the challenges you might get to tackle:
As a Software Engineering Intern you’ll assist in software development, and grow your understanding of programming languages
As a Product Management Intern you’ll work closely with Product Managers to gain understanding of IoT market segments, learn about customer needs, and assist in preparing business reports and data analysis

Who You Are

You’re an innovator, builder, and tinkerer with a passion for solving problems. Working with a global team of technology enthusiasts and design pioneers excites you. Here’s what you need:
Graduation date of May 2023 or later
Enrollment in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
A curious mind and a drive to succeed

More About Silicon Labs

We hire the most innovative talent in the world to solve the industry’s toughest problems, providing our customers with significant advantages in performance, energy savings, connectivity and design simplicity. Silicon Labs’ software and mixed signal engineering teams create solutions for customers in diverse markets including the Internet of Things, (IoT), internet infrastructure, TV tuners, as well as automotive and consumer radios. Our solutions are in products from the market leaders in home automation, electric vehicles, green technology, smart TVs and home voice control automation. We take pride in our products and in our people, and that’s one of the many reasons we continue to be awarded Most Respected Public Semiconductor Company by the Global Semiconductor Alliance.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Mobile Product Management Intern (Summer 2021)
requirements:
The world is changing as we know it. It’s more important than ever that communications and entertainment services are available to users to connect wherever they may be. Here at Dolby, our mission is to enable experiences that transcend expectations and reach the spectacular. We need your creative solutions and diverse thought. The Dolby U internship program offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders.

Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. For any student seeking to gain invaluable expertise through meaningful, personal contributions, we invite you to join us in continuing to design a future where technology meets entertainment!

Summary

We are looking for an intern for the Mobile Audio product management team. This individual will work closely with product management, engineering, sales and marketing to support new projects for Dolby Atmos for smartphones, tablets, and headsets, develop data-driven customer engagement tools based on Voice-of-the-Customer analysis, and run testing and experimentation to define new product features and functionality for mobile audio experiences.

Responsibilities
Work closely with the product team on defining feature sets to deliver the best mobile audio entertainment experience
Perform analysis on Voice-of-the-Customer data, mapping and presenting findings for incorporation into the product roadmap for mobile devices
Run value proposition testing and experimentation for quantification and development of new feature ideas
Establish quantifiable metrics for gauging and presenting music/video performance in smartphones and tablets and headphones
Build data-driven customer engagement tools for sales and marketing across the globe
Translate big picture product strategy into detailed requirements and hypothesis-driven proofs of concepts
Multi-task and collaborate with broader cross-functional teams to drive decisions and gather consensus


Qualifications
High attention to detail
Strong written and oral communication skills, and strong presentation skills
Enthusiastic, resourceful, and comfortable wearing many hats
Experience with Excel and data analysis tools a plus
Knowledge of customer research methodologies a plus


ELIGIBILITY
Working towards a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field; recent grads who are within 1 year of graduation are also eligible to apply
Must be available to work full-time Monday – Friday for 3 months between May/June 2021 – August/September 2021. Start dates for the internship are as follows: (*note* these dates are not flexible)
Monday, May 24, 2021
Monday, June 14, 2021
Monday, June 21, 2021
COVID UPDATE: This internship will be remote until further notice. Should conditions change, and we can safely allow employees to return to our campuses, there is a possibility of returning to onsite work


Dolby will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code, Article 49, and Administrative Code, Article 12

Equal Employment Opportunity

title: Product Management Intern (Remote & Unpaid Summer 2021)
requirements:
Are you looking to join one of the fastest growing software companies in the world? ThoughtSpot’s AI-Driven analytics platform is disrupting the BI industry by making analytics 1000x faster and easier for non-technical business users.

Are you passionate about defining and building revolutionary products that can change the face of the BI industry? Do you love analyzing user behavior to improve product engagement?

ThoughtSpot is seeking a Product Management intern to drive growth and adoption initiatives. This is an exciting opportunity to join a small team and be part of a rapidly growing company. During the internship, you’ll learn to convert customer feedback into an actionable roadmap.

Responsibilities
Deliver product improvement recommendations to drive adoption
Develop a strong understanding of the augmented analytics space using competitive analysis and industry research
Systematically collect end user feedback using market research methods like interviews and surveys
Analyze user behavior using engagement analytics
Setup user feedback collection methods and route them to user community or other internal stakeholders
Bring data informed user feedback and insights into roadmap planning and execution for rest of the PM organization


Qualifications
MBA student or a recent MBA grad with marketing or entrepreneurship specializations
2+ years of hands on experience with Business Intelligence tools
5+ years in consumer or enterprise software industry
Exceptional data-driven problem solving ability
Self-motivated and comfortable driving projects from start to finish
Strong verbal and written communication skills


About ThoughtSpot

At ThoughtSpot, we solve some of the hardest, most challenging problems in technology. The kind of problems we solve, requires diverse perspectives and the team-spirit to see those differences as opportunities rather than roadblocks. It’s why diversity isn’t a box to check; it’s the heart of “Selfless Excellence,” our core value we live every day. To make our dent in the universe, we seek employees with unique identities, backgrounds, and perspectives that want to build an inclusive, respectful company culture and truly challenge the status quo.

We support our employees with great benefits like 100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage for employees and dependents, equity in a late stage startup backed by top-tier VCs, conveniently located in Sunnyvale with an onsite gym, company-provided catered lunch and dinner, and paid holidays and flexible paid time off.

ThoughtSpot’s Search & AI-Driven analytics platform puts the power of a thousand analysts in every business person's hands. With ThoughtSpot’s next-generation analytics platform, business people can use Google-like search to easily analyze complex, large-scale enterprise data and get trusted insights to questions they didn’t know to ask, automatically - all with a single click. ThoughtSpot’s customers include the world’s largest companies, such as Amway, BT, Bed Bath and Beyond, Chevron Federal Credit Union, De Beers, JD Sports, PetCo, ServiceNow and Scotiabank.

ThoughtSpot is helmed by CEO Sudheesh Nair after being co-founded in 2012 by Ajeet Singh and technical co-founders from Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Oracle. Backed by investors Lightspeed Venture Partners, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst Partners, Geodesic Capital and Capital One Growth Ventures, ThoughtSpot has raised over $305 million to date at a unicorn valuation.

For more information please visit thoughtspot.com.

title: Product Management Intern - Pocket Geek
requirements:
Assurant is seeking a Product Management Intern with the opportunity to work remote from Home!

Job Description

This position is in the Pocket Geek Product Line Management group. We manage the lifecycle of the Pocket Geek line of apps, which enhance the value of Assurant’s mobile and home protection products and enable Personal Tech Pro, Assurant’s industry-leading support service. As an intern in our group you will support the Product Managers and deepen your knowledge of the craft of Product Management.

Key Responsibilities

As an intern on our team, you would be involved in a wide variety of projects, just like we are as Product Managers. Types of projects that our interns work on include:
Competitive Analysis – helping us craft our product roadmap by researching our competitors’ products and finding areas for improvement
Product Planning – helping our PMs with our Agile development process, writing user stories, participating in Agile ceremonies, tracking and reporting on progress
Product Communications – helping to shape presentations to management and our internal and external (B2B2C) customer base, helping PMs report on KPIs using app analytics and business intelligence
Market Research – working together with Assurant’s Market Research team to field surveys and synthesize/interpret 3rd party research to drive strategic product decisions
Product Marketing – assist our Product Marketing Director to develop marketing strategies and tactics for the Pocket Geek line of apps and services
Drafting documents, spreadsheets and presentations
This is a remote position

Basic Qualifications
This position is ideally targeted at students currently pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Business, Marketing or a related field.
Ability to operate a Windows or Mac computer
Familiarity with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)
Ability to use the Internet to find information related to assigned work
Familiarity with smartphones – Android and/or iOS, from a user and consumer perspective
General business knowledge from previous coursework or work

Preferred Qualifications
General work experience is helpful but not required.

title: Intern - Technical Product Management
requirements:
Intern - Developer Products Intern - Technical Product Management

Algorand is looking for an Intern - Technical Product Management in our Boston Office to support our Product and Developer Relations teams in building out code examples for the developer community. This is an opportunity for an active university student who is genuinely excited by the possibility of a career in product/engineering, passionate about working in a developing field, and has an interest in open source technologies, blockchain, and/or cryptocurrency.

In this role, you will prototype different types of DeFi applications on Algorand and publish accompanying code and written explanations on the Algorand Developer Portal. You will also write code templates as part of a new curriculum that will teach developers everything from sending their first transaction to building smart contract applications.

A stellar candidate will have high standards for code quality, evident from past projects or homework assignments. They will seek to provide instructive, concise, and well-organized code and uphold language-specific style guidelines.

Core Responsibilities
Write full code prototypes of interesting use cases, plus written explanations to be published on the Algorand Developer Portal.
Write concise, organized and instructive code templates to accompany a curriculum for developers in at least one SDK language (Go, Java, Python, JavaScript).
Run user testing and research studies.


Requirements & Qualifications
Evidence of high proficiency in at least one of the following languages: Java, Go, Python, JavaScript (bonus points for proficiency in JS frameworks like React, Vue, etc.).
For the programming languages they are proficient in, they will demonstrate attention to detail and adherence to style guides.
Knowledge or coursework in cryptography is a plus.
Active university student (must be returning in the Fall) in a related field
Experience with Git and GitHub
Participation in open source software projects preferred
Creative, approachable, energetic, “can-do” attitude with ability to change direction in a dynamic environment


Internships at Algorand are non-exempt temporary positions, with hourly rates set to market standards. You must be a matriculated university student, scheduled to return in the Fall.

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
Company SummaryJoin our team! First American Data & Analytics, a division of First American Financial Corporation, is a national provider of property-centric information, analytics, risk management and valuation solutions. First American maintains and curates the industry’s largest property and ownership dataset with over 7 billion document images. Our major platforms and products include: DataTree®, FraudGuard®, RegsData™, TaxSource™ and ACI®. The First American Data & Analytics division boasts more than 20 patents and remains at the forefront of innovation - leveraging technology and data to deliver best-in-class decisioning solutions. Fueled by our industry-leading data and using our technology and proprietary process, our solutions provide lenders, real estate and title companies with actionable insights - enabling them to make better, increasingly automated, decisions. With offices in all major metropolitan areas, including California and New York, DNA teams work collaboratively from across the country. First American (NYSE: FAF) is the ideal place to build your career. We believe our people are the key to the company’s continued success, and we invest in diverse talents and backgrounds and empower our teams to achieve more than they could anywhere else. First American has created an award-winning culture and as a result been named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for five consecutive years and more than 50 regional Best Places to Work lists. For more information, please visit www.FirstAmDNA.com.Job Summary
First American’s Data & Analytics Division is seeking currently seeking an energetic, analytical summer intern to join our Product Management team. This position is ideal for an individual who has an inquisitive mind and seeks answers to the question ‘Why?’.

Role/Responsibilities

The objective of the position will be to perform “Product Forensics” on the DataTree suite of products by its customer base. Responsibilities of the role include but not limited to:
Improve our monthly reporting results to provide greater, more in-depth insights into the performance of the DataTree product suite. This may involve generating analyses in Microsoft Excel and potentially using tools such as Power BI to help visualize the data to make it more consumable.
Utilize Pendo to identify usage trends within the DataTree.com product and define and standardize what we should be looking at on a regular basis to present evidence-based recommendations to Management regarding DataTree.com features
Perform market research for each of our current markets, understanding trends and potential new markets to help prioritize our growth efforts to help determine where to invest and where not to. This would consist of identifying and aggregating key market drivers/metrics (e.g., loan originations, loan applications, title orders, close rates, etc.)
Provide assistance with documentation, requirements and standardization of templates (e.g., Project Charters, Product Requirements templates/standards, etc.) for existing business processes
Assist with ad hoc requests as needed

Qualifications
Excellent analytical and communication skills, strong organizational skills, high attention to detail and initiative
Good listening, writing and communication skills for documenting processes and requirements
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to identify problems and review related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions
Demonstrate the ability to organize, plan, and prioritize work to meet deadlines accordingly
Demonstrate the ability to identify, document and collect market research information (e.g., macro level industry drivers, competitive information, etc.) to contribute to presentations and monthly reports
Provide samples of work and recommendations to be considered for this position
Candidates must be able to demonstrate a high degree of proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
Experience with Power BI Visualization and Pendo tools are a plus, but not required

Education / Professional Experience
Currently enrolled in and consistently working toward completion of a BA in Business or IT

First American invests in its employees' development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer.Based on eligibility, First American offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401K and other great benefits like an employee stock purchase plan. Analytical and creative problem-solving situations

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Experience leading entrepreneurial efforts and/or project management experience through class projects, clubs, or internships.
Analytical and solution-oriented background, with great people skills and structured problem-solving capabilities.
Good written and verbal communication skills.

title: Technical Product Management Intern - i-0016
requirements:
Company Description

When applying, please make sure you answer the 3 screening questions, attach 1 project, and submit your current college transcript or you risk losing your opportunity for consideration.

Here at KIOXIA America Inc, our creative force in the world of Storage represents extraordinary talent of people with a diverse range of skill-sets, interests and backgrounds carefully orchestrated to architect and design innovative SSD solutions.

Our Culture is composed of intelligent, curious people who collaborate respectfully together and are stimulated when being stretched beyond technical comfort zones and who thrive on engineering challenges and technological diversity. Simply put, our internship program will engage students with the opportunity to experience real work while providing a practical understanding of SSD technologies, as well our culture.

The KIOXIA Client SSD marketing team is a leader in global human data connectivity. How do people interact with one another and with their devices? What can we do to improve or reinvent the role our storage plays in the world around us? These are fundamental questions we grapple with every day while driving toward our business success. From smart phones, to connected IoT homes, personal computers, and the future autonomous vehicles, KIOXIA’s marketing team prides itself on the direct role we are playing in data storage across all those devices. Connecting humanity and helping provide the tools necessary for a better world.

Job Description

The KIOXIA Client SSD Marketing team is looking for a Technical Product Management Intern. In this role, you would be a key member of our team owning competitive analysis and test automation. This role will focus on the future deployment of competitor products for our key global customers. Through your analysis and insights, the team will drive changes to our product strategy. In addition to competitive analysis, we are looking to further automate our competitive testing suite and would love to have a creative coder to help build out our in-house infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to learn not just about storage, one of the backbones of the world’s infrastructure, but also take away transferrable skills in competitive analysis and product development.

Responsibilities
Creating scripts to automate SSD benchmark testing
Conducting competitive analysis by gathering data from various test scenarios
Creating analytical reports and charts from test data

Key Requirements And Skills
Experience with Object Oriented Programming (Preferably with Python)
Experience with Data processing, reporting, mining, or analytics
Experience with shell scripting
A passion for data analysis and its’ real world application
Must have a sense of personal ownership
Nice to have, but not required (We are happy to teach the right person):
Basic knowledge of SSDs
Working knowledge of how to build computers from components
Basic knowledge of running hardware benchmarks (PCMark 10, CrystalDiskMark, Iometer etc.)

Additional Information

INTERN WILL LEARN AND BE EXPOSED TO: Real world knowledge of user applications, global OEM requirements and inner workings, deep understanding of the relationship of hardware and software from the storage perspective, translating technical specifications into meaningful user value

Weekly team interactions: Hands on strategizing and planning, Participation in regular staff meetings, 1 on 1 reviews and coaching throughout the summer

Req# i-0016;
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Merchandising and Product Management Intern
requirements:
Merchandising and Product Management Intern

Walker Edison is a thriving, eCommerce company that relies on good data and hard-working employees to create an excellent experience for every customer. Our success comes from an attitude of innovation, never setting, and giving back to the community.

Our paid $16 hourly full-time internship program, takes emerging talent and offers experience leading to growth and mentorship. Over 15 weeks you will work closely with professionals in your field while engaging in projects with direct impact to the company. You will help us develop and implement improved processes to further the growth of Walker Edison.

As a Merchandising Intern at Walker Edison you will partner with the Merchandising team and spend 15 weeks learning what it takes to strategize, create, and produce the furniture assortment that ends up in ecommerce sites and stores. Merchants act as the bridge between data and product designers to curate an assortment from initial concept, through design, onto production and ultimately into customer’s homes. This role requires not only a passion for furniture and trend, but also a very strong analytical and business sense. If you love trends, but have a passion for business, this is the role for you.

Valuable experience to prepare you for future professional roles.

Experience working with a dedicated mentor, who will be there to guide you through.
Opportunity to provide direct impact to our company’s growth.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong problem-solving abilities
Strong customer service skills
Tech Savvy, knowledge with Microsoft Teams, Zoom and other platforms
Ability to assess, organize and prioritize tasks; ability to take direction as well as work independently and as a member of a team

Additional perks include complimentary vending machines, massage therapy, endless amounts of food, bi-weekly gifts, and subscriptions to the Calm App, a Music Streaming Service, and ClassPass. Walker Edison also offers several company and individual team building enrichment activities and educational classes throughout the year!

About The Company

Walker Edison Furniture is a market-leading, e-commerce drop ship business in the home furnishings realm with an unwavering focus on customer satisfaction every step of the way! Our brand and designs represent our desire to break away from the standard mold and help our customers "Live Outside The Box." This is an exciting time to join our expanding operations. We are an established business with huge future potential. Come join our team and be a part of a fun and growing company where we “Work Outside the Box”!

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
Company Details

We started in early 2019 as a small group of technologists with a passion for making insurance better. Today we are working with a team of industry experts who run five different insurance brands and collectively control $1 billion in annual premiums.

We believe in an idea and execution meritocracy. In other words, a place where the best ideas win and the people who deliver the most value get the most opportunities.

As we grow our team, we are looking for inquisitive, entrepreneurial people who are excited to reimagine the insurance industry.

Insurance is too complex. Help us make it better.

Responsibilities

What we’re looking for

The 10-week summer internship program provides emerging talent with hands-on experience with the commercial insurance industry, enabling you with skills to be successful going forward.

As a Product Management Intern, you will work with one of our Product Managers learning how to build successful software products that customers love. We are going to give you a lot of instruction and feedback in order to help you become highly effective in your role. We believe that people can only be effective when they have clarity, and we will strive to always give you clarity. We are looking for someone who will be dedicated to learning, taking action on feedback, and building great relationships with colleagues.

Beyond that, we’re looking for someone with a high degree of ownership, who values completing work and admits failures; someone who always seeks to understand the Why for things and never accepts an incomplete understanding; someone who is biased toward validating opinions with data and maintains a healthy skepticism about the subjective; and someone who is not afraid of technology and always learning new skills.

Your summer experience will enhance your business skills and you will be contributing directly to our goals and objectives

What Your Day Will Look Like
Delivering Results. You will learn how to curate the best ideas, hypothesize their value, and implement the most promising of them. We will ask you to constantly re-assess what we have built to make sure we are realizing actual value.
Focusing on the Data. We will assign you Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) that define your goals and quantify the results we aim to achieve. We will ask you to regularly review your indicators for actionable insights and to present your findings to stakeholders during OKR Reviews.
Understanding Our Customers. We will ask you to routinely expose yourself to customer feedback. You will use this exposure to anticipate customer needs and constantly improve their experiences.
Saying No . We will teach you how to choose the right problem to solve next. You will learn how to say no to things and to weigh short and long term trade-offs while keeping a healthy preference for long term solutions.
Challenging Status Quo . For various processes, we will expect you to understand what we do and why we do it. Then we will ask you to work across Business, Operations, Design, Data, and Engineering teams to reimagine how.

Qualifications

Skills you’ll need
Currently enrolled in a bachelor's degree program (open to all degrees and majors) with a graduation date of December 2021 or beyond
Excellent written and verbal communication
Ability to learn new things/track record of self-learning
Experience with SQL (is a plus)
Ability to read object-oriented code (is a plus)

What We’ll Bring
An engaged and supportive leadership team that will invest in you
Talented engineering teams to build products with
A broad group of industry experts who work closely with us on everything we do
Networking and mentoring opportunities

title: Supply Chain/Product Management Intern - Full-Time - Summer 2021
requirements:
Position:
Supply Chain/Product Management Intern - Full-Time - Summer 2021

Job Description:

Supply Chain/Product Management Intern - Full-Time - Summer 2021

Applications: November 2020 - January 2021

Interviews: November 2020 - February 2021

Internship: Approximately 10 weeks; June to August.

The 2021 Arrow Internship Program will be 100% virtual. All events, training and meetings will be virtual. Arrow will supply all interns with company equipment.

Based on your experience and interests, you will interview with and work on a team for approximately 10 weeks during the summer. Interns may be considered for potential full-time opportunities on based on their internship performance.

Who is Arrow Electronics?

Arrow Electronics is a global provider of products, services and solutions to industrial and commercial users of electronic components and enterprise computing solutions. Arrow serves as a supply channel partner for more than 150,000 original equipment manufacturers, value-added resellers, contract manufacturers, and commercial customers through a global network. The company maintains over 300 sales facilities and 45 distribution and value-added centers, serving over 80 countries.

A Fortune 109 company with 20,000 employees worldwide, Arrow brings technology solutions to a breadth of markets, including telecommunications, information systems, transportation, medical, industrial and consumer electronics. Arrow provides specialized services and expertise across the entire product lifecycle. Arrow does this by connecting customers to the right technology at the right place, right time and right price. Arrow provides extraordinary value to customers and suppliers - the best technology companies in the world - and connects them through the company's industry-leading services.

Why Be an Intern?

Hands-on approach to learning and applying your degree
Chance to network with 125 interns across the U.S.
Small forums with our Executives and past interns
Stretch your presentation skills in front of our VP’s and Directors

Functional Area

We have an exciting opportunity for full-time Summer Supply Chain/ Product Manager Interns. Product Managers are the liaison/interface between Arrow’s Suppliers and Arrow Sales Team. The main purpose of the position is to develop, grow, and leverage the influential supplier relationships, negotiate competitive pricing and availability, and increase sales and gross profit dollars for the branch or region. As the primary point of contact between the Arrow sales team and the supplier, Product Managers also manage the product literature distribution, and promote product lines within the branch/region.

Requirements & Skills

Currently enrolled and pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Supply Chain, Business, Operations, or Equivalent with a graduation date no earlier than May/June 2021
Available to work full-time (40 hours/week), virtually, during the summer (June through Mid-August)
Adequate WiFi
3.0 GPA or Higher
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to prioritize based on opportunities and effectively multitask
Experience using Microsoft Office
Detail oriented mindset
Quickly learn process of orders, inventory management, and data analysis
Problem solving – work with management to overcome obstacles within a supplier and makes it transparent to sales team

Hiring Rate/ Range:

$18 - $20 Hourly

Location:
US-CO-Denver, Colorado (Panorama Arrow Building)

Time Type:
Full time

Job Category:
Business Support
