title: Product Information Management (PIM) Data Analyst Intern
requirements:
Summary

PIM Data Analyst Intern

This team is responsible for executing a structured approach to the collection, creation, and maintenance of master product data through Motion’s PIM supporting the Item Database team. You will drive data integrity through data governance, change management, data ownership, and quality assurance. Must be able to work in a team environment. Works under general direction.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include but not limited to the following:
Creates, reviews, and approves product master change requests to ensure accuracy of data attributes
Manages data requests in support of business processes, new product sales initiatives, and M&A (Mergers & Acquisition)
Drives excellence and ensures continuous improvement in quality of data through cleansing and best practices for data construction
Reports KPIs related to material master data management and drives a system of actions to complete requests in accordance with SLA’s (service level agreements)
Provides input into the development of PIM data collection templates
Works collaboratively as a data steward within teams to ensure clear understanding of business requirements that are managed in concert with PIM data
Identifies opportunities to gain efficiencies, automate, and improve data quality
Partners with cross functional stakeholders to support business needs
Follows all SOX / Audit compliance requirements
Understand data governance and control distribution of data points
Actively engages in continuous process improvement
Knowledgeable and compliant of company policies and procedures
Other responsibilities as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS And EXPERIENCE
Typically requires a 4-year degree in business, operations, marketing, supply chain.
1-2 years’ experience in working in an MDM (ie. StiboSystems, Informatica, Salsify, etc)
Ability to work in a team environment
BI experience preferred, (ie Tableau, Qlik, etc)
Knowledge of workflow management techniques such as Lean Six Sigma, Kanban, etc.
Strong analytical problem solving skills.
Strong computing skills: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook)
Strong communication skills to convey ideas across the team and to other key stakeholders
Positive attitude

title: Hardware Engineering Project Management Intern
requirements:
Skydio is the leading US drone manufacturer and world leader in autonomous flight, the key technology for the future of drones and aerial transportation. The Skydio team combines deep expertise in artificial intelligence, best-in-class hardware and software product development, and operational excellence to empower a broader, more diverse audience of drone users - from action sports enthusiasts to first responders.

About The Role

Skydio, the industry leader in autonomous flight, is looking for an Engineering Project Management Intern to support new product development and sustaining production activities on Skydio's Hardware Engineering team. In this role, you will be a key cross-functional team member within the hardware organization, working closely with Engineering, Operations, Supply Chain, and external suppliers, to keep development and production programs on track.

In this internship opportunity, you will be offered mentorship to integrate with the Skydio hardware development teams and have high-impact ownership of key projects in various phases of the Skydio Product Design Process cycle. We are seeking top-performing individuals who seek to grow both technically, professionally, and personally through hands-on involvement in a fast-paced, impactful environment in this internship role.

How You'll Make An Impact
Coordinate cross-functional engineering efforts to validate running changes and post-ramp qualification activities for Skydio products in ongoing production (Skydio 2, Skydio X2, Skydio Enterprise Controller).
Ownership of early-phase new product development for new Skydio modules and/or subsystems, including creation of related schedules, coordination of engineering design planning and execution, and technical resolution of issues as they arise
Integration with Skydio manufacturing team and external suppliers as a voice of the hardware engineering development team, to coordinate issues, be hands-on with product fabrication and assembly, drive critical communication, and reporting key status updates to Skydio leadership.
Utilization of cross-functional development tools, systems, and processes (including but not limited to creation of Bills of Materials, Engineering Change Orders, OK2Fab for PCBA development, Clear-to-Build material tracking, and JIRA/Notion Issue organization and resolution) in order to provide leadership and effective execution on highly technical projects.


What Makes You a Strong Fit
Working towards completion of a degree in technical Engineering (Mechanical/Electrical/Firmware), Engineering Management, Product Management, or a similar related field
Past internship or co-op experience with a company that ships hardware products is preferred
Exceptional communication skills and natural ability to motivate/drive cross-functional internal teams and external vendors/partners towards a common goal
Highly analytical with the ability to organize and distill data as a key driver of rigorous product development decisions
Ability to remain flexible, calm, and creative in the face of uncertainty


At Skydio we believe that diversity drives innovation. We have created a multi-disciplinary environment that embraces the power of diverse perspectives to create elegant solutions for complex problems. We are committed to growing our network of people, programs, and resources to nurture an inclusive culture.

As such, we do not make hiring or other employment-related decisions on the basis of an applicant or employee's race, color, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), pregnancy, gender, gender identity or expression, age, religion, disability status, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, generic information or characteristics, veteran, military or family status, or other classifications protected by applicable federal, state or local anti-discrimination laws.

title: Product Management MBA Intern [United States]
requirements:
The Flex Company was founded on the belief that people deserve innovative and sustainable period products. Our mission is to create industry-defining products and services that set a new global standard for period health. Four years ago we launched the most innovative period product since the tampon: the menstrual disc. It had been nearly 80 years since the tampon was introduced, and our new product was quickly embraced by consumers everywhere. Flex started as a digitally native brand with one product, and quickly grew to a family of period products sold online and in top national retailers such as Target, CVS, and Walgreens.

The Flex Disc™and Flex Cup™ generate 60% less waste than tampons and pads and can be worn for up to 12 hours, all while maintaining the highest level of comfort through inventive engineering and rigorous testing. 

The Flex Company is seeking a Product Management Intern to join our Tech Product team to help our business and technology scale. Reporting directly to the Head of Tech Product the Product Management Intern will spend the summer researching, designing, prototyping, and developing a best-in-class mobile experience for our avid base of subscribers. This role will have a direct impact on the future of technology at The Flex Company and determine how our digital product experience enhances the physical product experience.

Responsibilities:
Research & Analysis of market trends in menstrual health that will inform strategy.
Competitive analysis and positioning for The Flex Company’s mobile experience in the broader menstrual health ecosystem.
Prototyping and wireframing with help from our fabulous Sr. UXUI designer of solutions.
Testing and learning to rapidly iterate on prototypes, leveraging unaware consumers and our enthusiastic subscriber base.
Prototyping with our amazing engineering team to bring concepts to life as an MVP product.
Financial analysis to determine overall impact of solution to The Flex Company’s outlook. 

About you:
You care about menstrual health equity and creating better solutions for people with periods.
You have a strong bias for action and an ability to distill ambiguity into an actionable plan.
You are someone who takes accountability, and is a great teammate.

Requirements:
Currently pursuing an MBA from an accredited university.
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.
3-5 years of experience (pre-MBA) in any combination of : Management/business consulting, Product Management, Brand Management, Venture Capital/Private Equity, or Entrepreneurship
Consumer-facing experience is a must, e-commerce experience a strong plus.
You possess a deep sense of customer empathy and use it to create better experiences.
You are a strong cultural fit - this is just as, if not more important than the functional fit (see The Flex Company values below).
Highly analytical (proficiency in generating unique, actionable, customer insights through data).
Proficiency in Asana, Tableau, SQL, and/or Excel a plus.
You know how to work cross-functionally with creative, growth, CRM and marketing to accomplish audacious goals.

In 1 month you will:
Become intimately familiar with the research, testing, and consumer insights gathered over the years at The Flex Company.
Identify and evaluate competitors for a future Flex mobile experience upgrade.
Distill reason to believe and positioning statement for a Flex mobile experience upgrade. 
Meet and get to know your team and all cross-functional teams.
Develop a deep understanding of our customer experience, growth and retention strategies and product roadmap.
Understand key reports, KPIs, and analytics tools.
Become fully integrated in the technology team’s day-to-day functions, including semi-daily stand-ups and weekly prioritization meetings. 
Review past audits on the current state of our conversion and retention funnels and develop a point-of-view on optimization.
Understand deeply the “why” behind everything we do.

In 2 months you will:
Test and iterate on the design of the Flex mobile experience to hone functionality and design.
Perform a financial evaluation of the Flex mobile experience upgrade to measure potential business impact.
Identify Key Performance Indicators that will determine product success. 
Gather feedback on designs from our stellar consumer insights and strategy teams and other cross-functional stakeholders.

In 3 months you will:
Build an MVP with our engineering team. 
Test your live MVP with a select set of consumers, gathering qualitative feedback.
Develop a plan for gathering quantitative feedback.
Adjust KPIs with new information from testing and prototyping and MVP.
Revise financials to reflect new product strategy. 
Present process, MVP, findings, and next steps to broader organization.

Our shared values:
Choose Love Over Fear: You make sound decisions from a belief in yourself, others, or opportunities rather than out of fear.
Optimize For Trust: You have a track record of taking accountability for mistakes rather than blaming others. You communicate needs, concerns, and feedback directly with colleagues. 
Have a Growth Mindset: You take constructive feedback well and actively seek feedback from colleagues. You are self-motivated to generate your best work and make a greater impact every day.
Be You: You are comfortable being your authentic self at work (including in the interview!).


About The Flex Company

Flex is sold at over 25,000 stores across the US and is the #1 alternative period product brand based on units sold. Committed to making its life-changing products accessible to as many people possible, Flex is available at Target, CVS, and Walgreens, and at flexfits.com.

The Flex Company is dedicated to equity in all that we do: from hiring to the design of our flagship products. Diversity is not a nice-to-have. It’s critical to the ideas, talent, and processes that help us create the most positive impact for our customers and for each other as colleagues. 

We are an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, age, and other protected classes. We encourage people of all backgrounds and identities including Black and other underrepresented minorities to apply to be a team member at The Flex Company.

We pay competitive salaries, equity, & benefits including (but not limited to) medical, dental and vision health insurance, paid parental leave, cell phone reimbursement, and $1,000 annual learning credit to apply to anything that helps you grow professionally.

title: Marketing Research Analyst Intern
requirements:
About JLG, An Oshkosh Company

JLG began in 1969, when our founder, John L. Grove set out to resolve growing safety concerns in the construction industry. Since then we have been committed to understanding the challenges and delivering innovative solutions to the access market. We partner with customers to provide quality equipment, training opportunities and trusted support within the access industry. We are a global company, and our products—including mobile elevating work platforms, telehandlers, utility vehicles and accessories—can be found all over the world.

The Product Management Analyst Intern will have the responsibility for executing tactical action plans to support the Aftermarket parts portfolio strategy implementation. Provide direct support to the Product Management Manager in managing the product portfolio lifecycle. Participate in the portfolio offering expansion effort by documenting and defining additional market opportunities. Participate in the coordination of new product development for the service parts portfolio. Align the product marketing goals with the overall Aftermarket goals.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

These duties are not meant to be all-inclusive and other duties may be assigned.
Work closely with marketing communications to develop product literature, advertisements, promotional materials, web pages, and photography to maximize the communication effort.
Coordinate with the Aftermarket teams (e.g. sales, marketing, communications, pricing, training, customer support, etc.) to apply an overall marketing strategy for the parts offering to the market.
Work with Global Procurement Supply Chain (GPSC) buyers to develop goals and measurements to maximize parts profit. Develop analysis that can be used to create management presentations of source-to-market efforts.
Track, analyze, and review program results to ensure cost, schedules, and product performance are being controlled and managed within established guidelines. Work with the sales team to understand demand drivers for product improvements.
Participate in the new product development process, providing support for the Aftermarket team to meet the defined requirements and goals for new parts.
Conduct market research, product development analysis, evaluate sale trends, gather customer perspectives, develop competitive environment analysis, and obtain sales team input to develop expected sale levels and identify Aftermarket opportunities by commodity groups.
Work with channel partners to develop joint plans for program development and distribution. Address planning, training, and market approach issues to assist the partner with their efforts.
Develop and deliver training activities and materials designed to improve the performance of the sales team and communicate the Oshkosh Corporation value proposition.


Minimum Qualifications

Enrolled in an accredited university in a related field of study
Minimum 3.0 GPA

Oshkosh is committed to working with and offering reasonable accommodation to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to disability for any part of the employment process, please contact us at: 920-502-3009 or corporatetalentacquisition@oshkoshcorp.com.

Oshkosh Corporation is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. This company will provide equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Information collected regarding categories as provided by law will in no way affect the decision regarding an employment application.

Oshkosh Corporation will not discharge or in any manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with Oshkosh Corporation's legal duty to furnish information.

title: Operations Intern, DSMI
requirements:
As an Operations Intern, you’ll serve as a liaison between Direct Supply sales teams and the manufacturers of Direct Supply Manufacturing, Inc. (DSMI) products. You’ll work directly with suppliers to manage their data and ensure our internal sales teams have the best possible information to deliver a great experience to our customers. You’ll work as part of the Business Support team to ensure product availability and on-time shipping. Additionally, the Operations Specialists support cross functional teams by managing the day-to-day business support tasks to drive efficiency and effectiveness across DSMI. If you’re interested in a role that exposes you to supply chain management, technology integration, product development, project management and international business, this position is a great fit for you!

This intern position is year-round, accommodating a part-time schedule during the school year and full-time during breaks and summer. This position may also lead to full-time employment upon graduation for the superior performer.

What You’ll Do And Impact
Deliver an exceptional service experience (e.g. calls, emails and other requests) and work across multiple teams to ensure product and supplier information is accurate and accessible to teams. Identify trends and repeat requests with a focus on eliminating or automating future work.
Analyze inventory against forecast and make ordering recommendations.
Provide crossover options to our order fulfilment team to reduce the impact of backorders.
Support supplier performance conversations and build relationships with vendors through an understanding of their perspectives and business concerns. Support team members in managing proprietary-product supplier relationships by communicating standard requests. This includes managing freight debits, aiding in service escalations, supporting product content audits, flyer details, product changes and additional responsibilities as needed.
Document DSMI processes such as sample ordering, updating supplier information, etc. and work with DSMI team to identify ways to eliminate or automate work in addition to improve overall processes.

What You’ll Need
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree program with a major in Supply Chain, Operations, or a business related field
Hours: school year - part time, approximately 20-25 per week; summer - full time, approximately 40 per week
Ability to shift priorities and deal with changing demands in an effective manner
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Task oriented with superior organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel and eager to learn and leverage new processes and technology

Additional Items Of Interest
Energetic, self-motivated individual with a desire to succeed
Experience in a software or technology company
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Direct Supply, Inc. and its U.S. subsidiaries are equal opportunity and affirmative action employers committed to diverse workforces.

title: Content and Social Media Intern
requirements:
Eliminate Crime. Build Community.

Flock Safety provides a public safety operating system that empowers private communities and law enforcement to work together to eliminate crime. We are committed to protecting human privacy and mitigating bias in policing with the development of best-in-class technology rooted in ethical design, which unites civilians and public servants in pursuit of a safer, more equitable society.

Our Safety-as-a-Service approach includes affordable devices powered by LTE and solar that can be installed anywhere. Our technology detects and captures objective details, decodes evidence in real-time and delivers investigative leads into the hands of those who matter.

While safety is a serious business, we are a supportive team that is optimizing the remote experience to create strong and fun relationships even when we are physically apart. Our flock of hard-working employees thrive in a positive and inclusive environment, where a bias towards action is rewarded. Flock Safety is headquartered in Atlanta and operates nationwide. We are well funded by Meritech Capital, Initialized Capital, YCombinator, Matrix Partners, BedRock Capital, and Founders Fund - and we're scaling quickly.

About The Opportunity

Flock Safety's Marketing team is hiring a summer intern to work on exciting projects with a great deal of customer and leadership visibility. This internship will position a student to use their creativity to draft new product- and customer-centric content, gain familiarity with commonly-used marketing and social media management platforms, and own several projects from start to finish. The intern will also gain the experience of working hands-on in a growth-stage startup environment where their work will have a real impact on the business. This is not a coffee-making internship!

The internship is part-time, 20-25 hours a week, from May-August 2021. We can also accommodate interns who want to seek course credit. It is largely remote for now.

How You Will Take Flight With Flock
Scheduling and managing (with oversight) Flock Safety's presence on social media platforms: Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram
Community management tasks on above platforms
Graphics creation, using templates and in accordance with established brand guidelines
Writing basic blog posts and case studies
Basic SEO tasks on website content (keyword tagging and research, page optimization)
Assisting with basic PR - sending media pitches, writing press releases
Update FAQs on website and collaborate with product, customer, and tech teams to write new FAQs
Additional research or projects as required


About You
Current student at a college or university, second year and up preferred; or recent graduate
Coursework or work experience related to marketing/communications
Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills
Familiarity with proper writing convention, stylistic choices (preferably AP style), and good writing practices
Proficiency in social media content and management, specifically on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn
Familiarity with social media analytics a big plus
Familiarity with the Adobe suite or other design software a big plus

Why join the Flock?

title: Energy - Compliance & Reliability Engineering Internship (Summer 2021)
requirements:
Disclaimer: This position is expected to start around May or June 2021 and continue through the entire Summer term (i.e. through August or September) or into early Fall 2021 if available. We ask for a minimum of 12 weeks, full-time, for most internships.

Please consider availability before submitting an application.

About The Teams

Test Systems Engineering - Mechanical Design

Intern will contribute to the design and development of our electronic systems. R&D Test Systems. Tesla as a whole uses countless HV power systems for R&D, engineering testing, and manufacturing applications. Part of our team’s mission is to repurpose the remarkable power electronics from our Vehicle and Energy platforms into internal products to cut millions in spending, shorten lead times, and increase functionality.

Responsibilities Include
Mechanical wrenching, basic fabrication, wiring, general electronics, soldering and debugging
Mechanical Design, Mechanical Assembly Drawings, and Wire Harness Diagram Creation
Updating/Creating Bill of Materials and Purchasing/Logistics
Product Lifecycle Management
Lead improvement initiatives to unlock new functionality, reduce cost, increase quality, ease manufacturing, and increase safety
Work with design and technician teams to prototype and validate changes

Test Systems Engineering - Software Engineering

Intern will contribute to the development of test software for a variety of R&D testing applications. The R&D Test Systems Engineering team designs and maintains test equipment for numerous engineering teams such as Mechanical Drive Systems, Motor Controls, Tesla Energy, and Firmware Validation to name a few. The fast pace development of Tesla products requires advanced, flexible testing applications in order to allow these products to mature and get to market as soon as possible.

Responsibilities Include
Develop and maintain software tools for a variety of test systems across Tesla R&D Engineering groups.
Work with cross functional teams to execute test plans on advanced prototype systems such as powertrain and vehicle dynamometers, high voltage power supplies, and component level testers.
Identifying places where software tools can be created or update to further benefit the work flow of the test equipment
Work with design and technician teams to validate hardware changes, providing feedback for future improvements

Compliance and Systems Testing

Intern will support the development of solar and storage products through system level testing for performance and compliance verification. One of the final stages in the development of a product is validating its performance in actual system conditions – as it would be in a home or business. The Compliance and Systems Testing group runs tests at outdoor facilities at the Tesla offices and other dedicated installations. This testing focuses on validating performance as well as meeting industry standard requirements for product certification.

Responsibilities Include
Hands-on support of solar array testing, addressing electrical, thermal, and functional performance
Analysis of data collected at test sites
Electrical schematic drawings, layout drawings, and other visual documentation
Development of reports using Excel, PowerPoint, or internal web-based platforms
Task organization and management, involving stakeholders from other departments
Creating test plans, bills of material, and test documentation templates
Logistics support for new or changing test arrays
Research tasks involving product test standards and requirements

Reliability Data Engineering

Intern will utilize large-scale data and help Tesla engineers design and validate the most compelling and reliable products for our customers. The reliability data team collects real-time life data from test and fleet (energy, charging, and vehicle products) and is responsible for retrieving, analyzing and summarizing results to cross-functional teams. The team provides support through the whole design cycle by building software and statistical tools that orchestrate all the reliability physics analyses.

Responsibilities Include
Apply statistical analysis to test (accelerated life) and field (life) data to inform reliability physics modeling/analyses and associated corrective actions
Work closely with Reliability and Design engineers to create/interpret/validate numeric models of fielded and in-test products
Contribute to the automation and standardization of our data pipelines
Build visualizations to effectively communicate results
Answer complex questions on fleet usage and behavior to enable proactive monitoring, grow reliability, and minimize field failures

Energy Storage and Charging Power Electronics

Regulatory product compliance is a critical business function and a rapidly expanding sector. Regulatory complexity is increasing and continuously evolving with many local, national and international codes, standards and regulations (CSRs).

Intern will support test and automation activities by designing, building and operating automated test equipment. Intern will test and interface with high power systems and subsystems. Intern will be able to contribute to the product construction reviews, execute product safety and grid interoperability testing, debug, data analysis, documentation, presenting and communicating results to the nationally recognized testing laboratories (NRTL’s).

Responsibilities Include
Design, build, and utilize test equipment
Improve test efficiency (Automation, regression testing, interfacing, data processing and report generation)
Execute product type testing and support construction reviews
Track adequacy and success of test suites against requirements
Collaborative work with design engineering and reliability teams

Requirements
Currently working towards a BS or MS in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Mechatronics
Proficiency with Mechanical CAD software (Catia preferred) and design/manipulation of large assemblies
Strong ability to troubleshoot electrical systems including using lab tools such as DMMs, oscilloscopes
Advanced knowledge in Python and LabVIEW. Knowledge of Pytest a plus
Strong knowledge of data structures, architectures and languages such as SQL
Basic familiarity with bus protocols such as CAN, Modbus, SCPI, Serial communication, etc.
Mastery of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Self-motivated with a desire to quickly drive solutions from concept to final implementation
Able to work under pressure, manage competing demands, tight deadlines and ability to problem solve
Strong propensity to build, assemble, and fix things
Preferred: Experience with high power electromechanical systems. Understanding of high voltage, electrical principles and reading/writing electrical wiring diagrams

requirements:

What we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. Apply now! All applications need to be in English. These internships will take place in Summer 2021.

Please note that this internship will likely be carried out on a remote basis. In the US, these states are: New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, California, Illinois and Washington State. If you are a resident and eligible to work in one of these states, you are free to apply for a remote internship in any of the King locations listed here. Please note that we will require evidence of your residence and eligibility to work as part of the application process.

About King

King is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with people all around the world playing one or more of our games, including franchises such as Candy Crush, Farm Heroes, Pet Rescue and Bubble Witch.
We have 249 million monthly active users as of fourth quarter 2019 across web, social and mobile platforms. King was acquired by Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq ATVI) in February 2016 and operates as an independent unit of the
company.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players – and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications needs to be in English.
Discover King at careers.king.com

Noc

Job Summary:

In the past the NOC has trained our interns in the operation of several of the systems we utilize to monitor the network devices, such as AOE, AMS, etc. This allows them to assist the NOC Specialists in the day to day operations of the NOC. We have also utilized our interns to research specific customer issues and product reports to management. Our most recent intern created new graphs for us to present our monthly metrics to the MetroNet Executives.

Mis

MIS Interns will go through a condensed new hire training curriculum to become familiar with our systems and tools. From there, they will work on several small items to become more familiar with the environment, code reviews and rollout processes. For a summer capstone project they will be given a medium to large project based on need, skillset, and interest. Front-end developers will gain experience with Node.js, React Native, GitHub, GraphQL and GCP. Middleware and back-end developers will gain experience with building or consuming web services using MuleSoft, a top of the line Enterprise Service Bus. In addition, they can expect to develop in C# and .Net Core, learn SQL to interact with Oracle databases, and version control experience using subversion and GitHub. Interested parties may also be able to continue their experience through an MIS co-op or through a sponsored software development senior project.

Marketing Analytics Intern

Extract data from various data sources into Excel to gain insight with regard to sales and marketing metrics. Organize data to create clear reports in excel and PowerPoint to draw conclusions and make recommendations. Focus of work could include gather and input call data, contacts, web site visits, media spend and sales data into defined sources daily for sales dashboard reporting, daily refresh of pivot tables, and updating dashboards daily.

Process Improvement

An intern in Process Improvement will assist in data analysis, analyze business processes for improvement opportunities, and utilize Six Sigma methodologies to determine how to best improve business processes.

OSP Pre-Design/Data Analytics

An intern will be analyzing data and then contribute to informed decisions. They will also be writing code using C#, Perl, SQL and Python. They will be given exciting projects that develop skills like reporting, attention to detail and project management.

Voice And Video

An intern would spend a several weeks learning some entry level IP networking, what is SIP and Softswitch basics. The intern would perform an audit of existing headend documentation to being up to date Visio and excel documentation and eventually assist installation and activation of new channels for the IPTV platform. After a period of time the intern would be permitted to assist in troubleshooting/ticket resolution.

Provisioning

A Provisioning intern will perform Directory Listing updates on telephone numbers throughout the MetroNet network. The intern will also assist with customer orders with a focus on disconnects. They will also help with reporting and data analytics.

Business Tech Support

An intern in Business Tech Support will first take inbound commercial customer calls to build a foundation of knowledge. Then the intern will develop departmental training material and testing tools via our company system. The intern will also assist with departmental metrics, reporting and data analytics.

Business Test And Turn-up

The Business TTU intern will be responsible for configuring Adtran equipment as well as Algo Paging equipment. They will also be responsible for collecting and consolidating auto generated KPI reports for both Business TTU and Business Tech Support.

What You Need For This Position
Pursuing degree in related field
Ability to work as part of a team and independently while contributing to the success of the team
Highly motivated, organized, reliable, and detailed-oriented
Strong written and verbal communications skills
Quick learner and not afraid to work with new computer-based programs and databases
Ability to be effective and contribute in a fast-paced corporate environment
If you have a strong desire to impact, the success of our organization by ensuring we continue to attract and retain committed professionals, please apply today!

MetroNet is an EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Headquartered in Evansville, Indiana, MetroNet is a customer-focused company providing cutting-edge fiber optic telecommunication services, including high-speed Fiber Internet, full-featured Fiber Phone, Fiber IPTV with a wide variety of programming, and a home security product called MetroNet SmartHome.

We got our start in 2005, with our first fiber optic network in Greencastle, Indiana, and have since expanded into 50+ communities throughout Indiana, Illinois, and Kentucky. All MetroNet services are delivered across our 100% fiber-optic network made up of thousands of miles of fiber optic cables connected directly to homes and businesses.

At MetroNet, we are committed to bringing state-of-the-art telecommunication services to the communities we serve by delivering services comparable or superior to those offered in large metropolitan areas. This commitment not only means better internet, television and telephone options for our customers today but also the capacity to continually provide additional products and services in the future as new uses for 100% fiber are developed.

Our commitment to our communities doesn’t stop at bringing exciting new technology. We’re also proud to have local retail stores, staffed with friendly associates and technicians who actually live in the communities we serve. We find it is always reassuring to see a familiar face when your services are installed or when you stop by our store. Our innovative store design allows customers to test drive MetroNet products at interactive kiosks, sign up for services, pay their bills, and much more.

title: Intern
requirements:
Those who join Emergent BioSolutions feel a sense of ownership about their future. You will excel in an environment characterized by respect, innovation and growth opportunities. Here, you will join passionate professionals who advance their scientific, technical and professional skills to develop products designed-to protect life.

Position Summary

The postbaccalaureate internship for recent college graduates is a great opportunity to engage in ground-breaking research and development within the Vaccines Business Unit.

You will work alongside seasoned scientists who strive to discover novel treatments and vaccines for viral and bacterial infections. You will gain experience using multiple data searching and data analysis platforms as well as report writing, product development and program management. The intern will report for 8 hours per day for approximately 1 year. At completion, the intern provides a PowerPoint presentation and a written summary report.

Essential Functions

Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Conduct research in the area infectious disease epidemiology (no laboratory work required). Assist in program management activities including drafting, revising and organizing project reports.
Follow good documentation practices and maintain a database of reports.
Maintain progress during the internship toward the specific goals outlined for the intern. Adhere to Company safety guidelines and complete all required training.


Minimum Education, Experience And Skills
Candidate must have obtained a bachelor's degree in life or health sciences less than one year prior to the date they begin the internship.
BS degree in epidemiology, biology, biochemistry, molecular biology, public health or a related field.
Completed advanced classes in Biology, Epidemiology, Statistics (or Mathematics) and/or Ecology to be able to understand the science and keywords and carry out statistical analyses, literature reviews, and database work.
Research experience and experience with database and/or programming packages (e.g., SQL, Access, R, SAS) is a plus but is not required.
Understanding of vaccines and/or infectious diseases is a plus but is not required.
Must have strong communication, organization, and record keeping skills. Must be self-directed and able to work remotely for the near term.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office.
Self-motivated, with excellent organizational and critical-thinking skills
Ability to use excel spreadsheets, graphical and presentation software


There are physical/mental demands and work environment characteristics that must be met by an individual to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. This information is available upon request from the candidate.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform all essential functions.

title: MBA Intern - Product Management
requirements:
Please note this role is open to remote hiring.
Who is Drive DeVilbiss …
Formed in 2000, Drive DeVilbiss has become a leading manufacturer of medical products with a strong and consistent track record of growth achieved both organically and through acquisitions. We are proud of our high-quality, diverse product portfolio, channel footprint and global operating scale. Our products are sold into the homecare, long-term care, retail and e-commerce channels in more than 80 countries around the world.
“Our Mission is to enhance the quality of life of the people we touch”
Your Mission
The MBA Intern – Category/Product Management will support the strategy development and execution for 2 key product categories. You will own the oversight and management of your category, from market research to analysis to messaging and campaign creation. Your initiative and desire to work in a fast-paced environment will be the key to success as this role is held by those who are self-starters that possess great personal leadership.
This position is perfect for MBA candidates on the consumer marketing or corporate strategy track. The paid internship begins in early May and will last for approximately 16-24 weeks. We require 25-30 hours per week at a minimum. We welcome the opportunity to apply your time with us towards university credit.
In This Internship, You Will
Manage new product development and commercialization projects
Brief development for packaging and marketing
Competitor, category and consumer research, including analysis and presenting recommendations
Identifying and evaluating new product and business ideas
Price analysis, using market and internal data
Developing PowerPoint presentations to communicate strategic recommendations
At a Minimum, We Would Like You To Have
Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Business Administration or another advanced degree, with 2-4 years’ work experience
Experience with Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent verbal & written communication skills
Strong Business/financial acumen and a data-driven approach to decision making
Must be available to work a minimum of 25-30 hours per week for 16 weeks
EEO Statement: Drive DeVilbiss is an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law. Drive DeVilbiss complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

title: Sales Intern
requirements:
Join FuelCloud’s sales internship program and experience a fast-paced and innovative environment. This is not the internship for someone looking for the traditional regimented office job. This internship is for the outgoing person who is curious, excited to learn and has top-notch presentation skills. You enjoy a challenge, are not afraid to try something new, and looking to jumpstart on your career.

What we do
FuelCloud is a technology company building software and hardware to manage bulk fuel tanks. We have shaken the status quo in an old-school industry by building a tech-focused solution addressing the problems that organizations of all sizes - from small businesses to Fortune 500 corporations - have with monitoring and managing their bulk fuel use. 

Since our founding in 2015, we’ve patented 3 new fuel management technologies, installed our core product on bulk fuel tanks around the world, and helped some of the largest companies on earth solve their fuel management problems.

What you’ll do
The internship program has been an important part of the company’s growth, and this year we are expanding the program to be the biggest yet. We are looking for sales interns who will become experts on our product and help us grow even faster. Responsibilities will include making sales, sales pitching, customer management, CRM interfacing, lead generation, and presentation. 

Feel free to check out our website FuelCloud.com and contact our most recent intern, Grant Mathews at his LinkedIn page to learn more about his experience as an intern.

What we’ll do for you
The sales internship program plays a crucial part in driving FuelCloud’s growth. To welcome the best and the brightest talent, we offer a compelling package of benefits:
Competitive pay structure: $15/hour, plus commission on sales you help complete
Comprehensive training: We’ll teach you all we know about how to be an effective salesperson
Work From Home Fridays: Stay in your PJs or dress up to the nines -- either way, you’ll be at home
Opportunity for a full-time offer after graduation: We hire for full-time roles directly from our internship program
Pacific Fuels and Convenience Summit: The top intern will join the Sales Team as they head to San Diego for a late summer tradeshow

What we’re looking for
Graduating 2021 or 2022: We need successful interns to join our team as soon as possible
Organized and effective work ethic: Staying on top of multiple tasks and getting your work done when it needs to be done are crucial
Outgoing personality with good presentation skills: You’ll be interacting with customers, distributors, and the rest of the team on a daily basis
Curious and fearless about new opportunities: Having a willingness to try new things and take on bigger challenges will serve you well


“Hi I’m James W. I’ll be overseeing your summer 2021. This is a program that started with me as the first intern. Since that internship, I have accelerated my career and professional skills faster at FuelCloud than I could have anywhere else. With our small team, you will be given big responsibility. No time for fake customers. We need hard working, personable people who are excited to start real work yesterday. If you are interested, please apply and feel free to message me on LinkedIn.” –James

title: Gas Power Digital Technology Intern – 2022
requirements:
Job Description Summary

Job Description Summary


Job Description

GE Gas Power is seeking sharp, personable, highly-organized interns who are looking for the opportunity to grow their technical and professional skills while building a career with unlimited potential. Interns will learn from the best in the industry and work on substantial projects with real world implications, getting hands-on with digital technologies!

Essential Responsibilities

We offer meaningful, impactful assignments as well as an assignment that includes team building, career development opportunities, and more! Digital Technology Interns are GE’s primary pipeline to full-time employment opportunities either as a direct hire or as a member of one of our worldclass early talent leadership programs. Digital Technology Interns are hired to focus on a particular area of the GE business based on availability of positions, the interviewer's assessment, and the applicant's preference.

Focus areas could include but are not limited to Predix/Digital Platforms, Digital Engineering, Data Analytics & Operations, Technical Product Management, and more.

Digital intern assignments, typically 10 to 12 weeks in length, are dynamic and challenging based on the business needs and the type of work required. Interns have significant exposure to key IT and Software business leaders at GE; as well as a global internship support network to accelerate learning and development.

Potential Locations Include:
Greenville, South Carolina; Schenectady New York; Atlanta, GA; and other Gas Power Locations

Relocation Assistance:

Co-op/Interns will be reimbursed for reasonable, proper, and documented expenditures incurred while initially reporting to work and returning to school/home upon completion of the assignment. Employees with a permanent address greater than 50 miles from the work location are eligible.

Housing Allowance

Co-op/Interns employees receive a weekly housing allowance to help off-set living expenses when the co-op/Intern’s permanent residence is at least 50 miles away from the work location.

Employment Dates
January to May 2022 (Spring)
May/June to August 2022 (Summer)
August to December 2022 (Fall)
Co-Op opportunities to be staffed and defined as applicable

Qualifications/Requirements
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree program at an accredited university or
credentialed software accelerator program.
Degree focused in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, IT
Security, Informatics, Information Science/Technology, Management Information Systems,
Software Engineering, Security and Risk Analysis, or other relevant STEM majors with Software/IT
experience.
Must maintain a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA (without rounding).
Must submit your application for employment through https://www.ge.com/university
Must be willing to take a drug test as part of the selection process
Must be willing to submit to a background investigation as part of the selection process
Must be 18 years of age or older
Must be able to develop and maintain good customer relationships
Must have reliable transportation and a valid driver's license
Must be willing to work in geographical area specified by the business
Must have the ability to work in the US for an unlimited amount of time without sponsorship

Desired Characteristics
Prior intern, co-op, or research experience in software, IT or relevant area.
Leadership experience inside and/or outside the classroom.
A strong commitment to a career in technology and passion/aptitude for both software and
information technology.
Strong analytical and technical skills with experience in software industry standards and
development tools.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to articulate clearly.
Demonstrated creative problem solving and proactive learning.

Additional Information

GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer . Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

Relocation Assistance Provided: No

title: Customer Success Operations Internship - Summer 2021 (Remote US)
requirements:
Company Description

FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. Learn more about FireEye's world-class solutions and global footprint at https://www.fireeye.com/company.html.

Job Description

The Mandiant Customer Success (MCS) team is seeking a Customer Success Intern to join us for the summer of 2021. The MCS team is responsible for ensuring customers achieve their business goals using Mandiant Solutions product offerings. The team’s primary goal is to speed customer value and expected outcomes through efficient onboarding, increased adoption, and expert engagement and guidance across strategic and tactical customer audiences. The focus of this unique internship will be to support innovation within the Customer Success practice, leveraging customer relationship management and related technology, to scale our ability to provide value to a rapidly expanding customer base. The successful intern will work closely with the Manager of Customer Success Operations, across the entire Customer Success Practice and with exposure across key aspects of Mandiant business, including Mandiant Threat Intelligence, Mandiant Security Validation, and Mandiant Defense, to accomplish assigned tasks.

Responsibilities
Develop focused skillsets related to customer relationship management and supporting technology
Work closely with Customer Success Operations to help build and maintain best-in-class customer experience consistently throughout the customer lifecycle, at scale
Collect and organize process information related to Customer Support and Customer Success Management workflows
Engage with representatives from key business partners to gather relevant business process information and related data points
Work with broader Customer Success teams to support priorities and drive efficiencies
Help build workflows, reports, and dashboards, as assigned
Leverage collective body of knowledge to support the design and development of solutions for key Customer Success initiatives
Assist with delivery of Customer Success initiatives from design to deployment

Qualifications
Currently pursuing a degree ideally in business administration or similar
Ability to analyze processes for potential gaps and improvements
Intermediate to advanced Excel
Experience writing reports
Ability to analyze data and provide detailed analysis
Ability to manage small projects and provide timely deliverables
Must be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship

Additional Qualifications
Strong writing skills with ability to communicate clearly and efficiently
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate in a team environment
Ability to prioritize, meet tight deadlines, and work with minimal supervision

Additional Information

At FireEye we are committed to our #OneTeam approach combining diversity, collaboration, and excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

(Colorado applicants only*)

Minimum Hourly Rate: $20. Final rate will be determined commensurately with cost of living, experience level, and/or any other legally permissible considerations.

Benefits: Employer subsidized benefits include Medical Insurance. FireEye also provides Flexible Paid Sick Time and Paid Holidays.

title: Product Management Intern (Virtual)
requirements:
2021 Summer Intern Product Management

Virtual

The Commercial Real Estate (CRE) industry is at an inflection point. The technological disruptions that have already transformed retail, travel, and transportation have been slower to emerge here, but they are coming at full speed. JLL, a globally recognized leader in CRE, recognized these forces early, and is making massive investments in technology to transform both itself and the industry as a whole .

JLL Technologies (JLLT) is the tech arm of JLL, with the dual mandate of growing the company’s technology revenue while also driving market share and margin gains in our existing business. Our mission is to leverage technology to increase the value and liquidity of the world's buildings, while enhancing the productivity and the happiness of those that occupy them.

We are currently seeking a Summer Intern in Product Management to join our growing team . In this role, you will learn the craft of product management and have the opportunity to lead the definition, development and launch of a high impact feature on one of our key strategic products. JLL has multiple positions open under this Product Management role.

Areas of focus include-
Product market research and analysis
Product strategy
Product case studies
Project/program/portfolio management
Training and demos
Rollout support
Technical writing

What This Job Involves

As a Summer Intern in Product Management at JLL Technologies, you will -
Conduct user research to scope and define an enhancement to one of our products
Work with our design and engineering teams to develop the feature you recommend
Develop materials and collateral (e.g., email content) to publicize the change
Analyze the resulting data to measure the outcomes of your efforts

Actively pursuing a technically-oriented bachelor’s degree , with 2-3 years completed (e.g., computer science, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, etc.)
Minimum 1-2 computer science classes completed

Exceptional verbal and written communication

We succeed together—across the desk and around the globe and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay. We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL T . Apply today!

title: Product Management Intern, MBA - Summer 2021
requirements:
Squarespace is a design-centric product company at heart which enables anyone to build a beautiful online presence. Product Managers at Squarespace are embedded within product teams amongst product designers, engineers, researchers, and analysts. Our product teams are deeply collaborative, and each member is directly responsible for the team's success.

As an intern, you will work alongside full-time product managers on our Growth team that is responsible for revenue expansion. The Growth team sits within the Platform group, which is responsible for the user's journey with Squarespace by providing a consistent and holistic experience across products. Teams are driving outcomes related to increasing revenue for existing customers as well as leading efforts into new markets and customer segments.

You will be challenged in an ambitious, ever-changing organization that values vision, execution, persistence, curiosity, and flexibility.

Responsibilities
Own solving a customer problem end-to-end, from strategy to execution by working directly with a full-time Squarespace product manager and a team of designers and engineers
Partner with Product Analysts and UX Research to conduct and examine direct user feedback, qualitative research, and quantitative data that optimize for customer success
Develop hypotheses and drive creative, cross-functional ideation and solution discovery
Conduct market research to help inform early long-term bets
Maintain communication with the entire team to ensure effective collaboration and transparency
Present findings broadly to interested product teams throughout the company


Qualifications
Recent graduate (2020 or later) or enrolled MBA student (Spring 2022 anticipated graduation)
You have strong written and interpersonal communication skills
You have strong familiarity with web technologies (coding experience not required)


About Squarespace

Squarespace makes beautiful products to help people with creative ideas succeed. By blending elegant design and sophisticated engineering, we empower millions of people — from individuals and local artists to entrepreneurs shaping the world's most iconic businesses — to share their stories with the world. Squarespace's team of more than 1,200 is headquartered in downtown New York City, with offices in Dublin and Portland. For more information, visit www.squarespace.com/about.

Today, more than a million people around the globe use Squarespace to share different perspectives and experiences with the world. Not only do we embrace and celebrate the diversity of our customer base, but we also strive for the same in our employees. At Squarespace, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or other class protected by applicable law. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

title: Market Intelligence and Strategy Intern
requirements:
Appian is a platform for building enterprise software applications, faster. With Appian, customers get the speed of low-code development with the power of intelligent automation in one trusted and unified cloud platform.

At Appian, we’re seeking to grow our culture of passion, energy, and innovation; Empowered by the “the best idea wins,” we thrive on collaboration and a culture of dissent, encouraging all employees to challenge and elevate one another. We strive for diversity and inclusion through continued education and a commitment to equity.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to accelerate their career by working with top professionals across Sales, Marketing and Engineering. This is a highly visible role. This role reports into the office of the product strategy team.
Reports to: Senior Director, Market Intelligence and Strategy Group Mission and Vision:

We Are Responsible For

The Market Intelligence and Strategy group is responsible for analyzing Appian’s competitors, buyers, markets and prospective markets.
Developing winning competitive strategies, world-class sales tools and sales enablement
Delivering support to our sales team for their competitive needs, including presenting our differentiators to prospects
Determining why we win and lose business, and sharing these findings cross functionally while recommending changes
Providing competitive insight for executive decision making
Analyzing and reporting key market events and developments
Collaborating with product management to research new solution markets

The Market Intelligence and Strategy Intern will serve as a member of the Product Strategy Team during the Summer 2021 and will support the Market Intelligence function within the product strategy team.
About the Position: In this important role at Appian, you will:
Help Appian understand and articulate our differentiators
Conduct deep competitive research and develop corresponding competitive strategies
Develop world class sales tools including presentations, comparisons, and videos
Assist in developing competitive sales training
Research and analyze market events, including new product announcements, competitor earnings, and acquisitions
Assist in managing the library of competitive content
Assist in analyzing why Appian wins and loses opportunities


About You
Must be a current junior, or rising senior
Developing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Economics, Business or another quantitative field of study
Exceptional creativity and problem-solving skills
Able to multitask with research projects, data analysis, and coordination with others
Creative and collaborative
Strong decision-making skills and the determination to see projects through to the end
Possesses good people skills with the ability to develop respect and trust with team members

Appian helps organizations build apps and workflows rapidly, with a low-code automation platform. Combining people, technologies, and data in a single workflow, Appian can help companies maximize their resources and improve business results. Many of the world’s largest organizations use Appian applications to improve customer experience, achieve operational excellence, and simplify global risk management and compliance. Our employees create opportunities to drive hands-on impact both with our customers and throughout the organization, which creates an environment where meaningful work is met with career growth and opportunity. As a result, we are proud to have been recognized as a Washington Post Top Workplace for seven consecutive years. Simply put, we are changing the way businesses operate and our employees are to thank for Appian’s success.

Appian Corporation is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Further, Appian will not discriminate against applicants for inquiring about, discussing or disclosing their pay or, in certain circumstances, the pay of their co‐worker, Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination .

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at ReasonableAccommodations@appian.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.

title: Product Management Intern
requirements:
At Verizon Media, we connect people to their passions. With brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and more, we help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. From XR experiences to advertising and content technology, Verizon Media is an incubator of innovation and is revolutionizing the next generation of content creation in a 5G world.

2021 Product Management Intern

At Verizon Media, we connect people to their passions. With brands like Yahoo and TechCrunch, we help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. From XR experiences to advertising and content technology, Verizon Media is an incubator of innovation and is revolutionizing the next generation of content creation in a 5G world.

The Consumer Product Experiences (CPE) team is looking for aspiring product managers with a passion for technology, product, and design to join our Product Management Internship program and help tackle the biggest challenges in technology and media. This role will work directly with engineering, design, editorial, UXR and other groups to support our diverse set of Consumer-facing products. You will contribute directly to projects responsible for ensuring we reach our 2021 audience and revenue goals while meeting and exceeding the unique needs of our users.

About The Yahoo Product Management Internship Program

As a Verizon Media Product Management Intern you’ll join a team for 12 weeks and help execute the end-to-end product strategy and development for high-impact projects across the company. You’ll also be part of a selective community of product interns who will challenge and inspire you in your journey and be paired with senior product leaders to support your growth and evolution.

Responsibilities
Contribute to and execute product roadmaps oriented around our 2021 OKRs
Prioritize user needs and articulate what problem should be solved, for whom, how, and why
Work collaboratively with engineering, design and other key stakeholders.
Analyze performance based on agreed-upon success metrics
Work with product leads to groom the backlog and manage shifts in overarching priorities
Learn more about the broader Verizon Media business and its goals
Essential Qualities
Product sense: Strong product sense with an ability to envision technology solutions that address user needs and market opportunities
Analytical ability: Excellent problem solving and analytical skills: you should be able to break down open-ended problems and move forward in the face of ambiguity
Entrepreneurial spirit: Passion for technology products and services. Show us what you want to build. Tell us what products you love, how you want to change this space, and why
Communication skills: Strong written and oral communication skills in order to work effectively with engineering, design, and cross-functional teams

Nice To Have
Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program in Computer Science or related technical field.

About Verizon Media

Verizon Media, a subsidiary of Verizon, is the parent entity of Yahoo, AOL, TechCrunch, RYOT, HuffPost, and dozens of other brands that together reach more than a billion people every month. Creating and operating a diversity of media, communications, search, and advertising products at scale requires talented people to smartly apply technology, product insight, and user-focused design.

title: Volk Intern - Various Opportunities
requirements:
Intern Opportunities
Technical Marketing (NEW Opportunity as of June 2019)
Graphic Design and Marketing Intern (High Demand)
Engineer Intern – the Product Development team
Engineer Intern- Quality and Regulatory
Project Intern – Diagnostic Imaging
Management/Project Management Intern
Operations - Process Improvements


Technical Marketing Intern

The product marketing team is responsible for deep research and scientific understanding of our customers, products, and markets and translating this into content to drive market growth. Our team is looking for motivated individuals for a summer internship opportunity. Must possess excellent attention to detail and critical thinking. Doesn’t mind jumping between different tasks, and sometimes venturing outside of a job description

Required Skills
Engineering/ technical background, experience with medical devices is preferred
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Should have a keen eye for design and detail

Here are some of the projects you will be working on:
Create training materials: Transform and author product training materials to be clinically and technically accurate. The resultant training materials should also be up to date with Volk’s current branding.
Technical/Marketing solutions: Take ownership and manage of solution-oriented research. Project steps will include gaining insight into the project requirements and precautions for each class of product and identifying viable solutions that do not degrade the optical properties of the lens.
Research and testing phase will entail testing and quantifying the effectiveness and safety of identified solutions and result in educated recommendations.
Market research: Market research and analysis of the opportunity to integrate/introduce product portfolio into various areas. The project scope includes understanding and defining the vision care needs of the in the industry outlining the major disease states and treatment plans employed. This should be followed by an analysis of strategic placement opportunities for the product portfolio.

Graphic Design Marketing Intern

This intern position is a member of the marketing team with a focus on creating communications programs that effectively describe and promotes Volk and its products. This includes the design and execution of digital and print marketing campaigns; building and maintaining the Volk web and social media footprint
Internship - flexible duration
Degree Areas - graphic design, marketing, communications or related areas of study

Here are some of the projects you will be working on: In this role, the Graphic Design Intern will be designing social media graphics/strategy, print literature, email campaigns, photo editing.

Engineer Intern - Product Development Team

The Product Development Team at Volk is responsible for the development of exciting new medical devices to benefit the eye health of individuals worldwide and is looking for a motivated person with experience in embedded systems.
Summer Internship
Ability to work part-time during the spring semester a plus
Desire to work in a small, focused, and fast-moving team
Bachelor’s or Master’s student in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related discipline
Microcontroller programming
Android and/or iOS application programming
The electrical schematic and PCB design

Here are some of the projects you will be working on:

Project Intern For Diagnostic Imaging
Engineering background not necessary
Preferably senior

Here are some of the projects you will be working on:

Pictor Plus Tech Support Operational Efficiency Improvement

It would be great if we have someone who can create a written troubleshooting guide of all the different commonly asked questions we get with solutions. The solutions would be pictorial and with text. Additionally, for complex things, training videos would also be created. Further, this individual would train the entire CS team on these questions, so they are self-sufficient in answering questions and start becoming comfortable. They would also create this content to put on our website, so we can direct people to this area. This intern will also investigate modern tech support solutions such as Virtual reality and other AI based solutions.

Pictor Plus Loaner and Demo Tracking. As you know we don’t have good visibility or control over our Pictor Plus units. It would be great if someone comes in and figures this whole issue out and then puts in place a system to track units, collect customer credit cards at time of demo, send regular reminders, and charge credit cards if not returned in a timely manner. There would also be a system this person would put in so we know how many units we have at any given time and at our fingertips.

Project Intern For Quality And Regulatory
Summer Internship
Ability to work part-time during spring semester a plus
Desire to work in a small, focused, and fast-moving team
Bachelor’s or Master’s student in Engineering or related discipline
Microcontroller programming
Android and/or iOS application programming
Electrical schematic and PCB design

They will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and monitoring document control activities per FDA/ISO 13485 and international medical device regulations. In addition, the specialist will be responsible for material returns and repairs for national and international customers by managing the RMA process and resolving customer issues and complaints.

Project Intern – Management/Project Management
Summer Internship
Ability to work part-time during spring semester a plus
Desire to work in a small, focused, and fast-moving team
Talent for planning and organizing

Helping to put processes and systems in place within the home office. They would also create this content to put on our website, so we can direct people to this area.
